The flower components are hand-made by the designer, formed in clay and baked in an oven.

The first edition was published in May 2016 for the Tokyo Game Market (TGM). The second edition, published in December 2016 for TGM, includes another set of rules in addition to the first edition's rules.

The first edition's rules descriptions in the rulebook are slightly adjusted, but its rules are basically passed down as is to the second edition.

Publisher's summary
「箱庭の国」は、魔法にかけられた花たちの庭園を舞台にした二人用ボードゲームです。
手番では、プレイヤーは「庭師」と呼ばれる駒を移動させ、手元のカードを使って「開拓」アクションを実行します。
その結果、「庭師」を中心としたボード上の一定範囲に自分の石が置かれて陣地となり、逆に相手の石は取り除かれていきます。
このゲームでは、「庭師」も陣地も積み上げられた石で表現されており、局面は同じ形状をした石の裏表と積み重ねのみによって形作られます。
陣地を12マス得る、相手の「庭師」を無力化するなどの条件を満たしたとき、ゲームに勝利します。

217197.name: Lucky Forward: Patton’s Third Army in Lorraine
boardgameintegration: Wacht Am Rhein
Wacht Am Rhein
217197.description:
Description from the publisher:

Lucky Forward: Patton’s Third Army in Lorraine (6 Sep-13 Dec 1944). This game would present Third Army’s Fall 1944 offensive to just before the Germans launch their Ardennes Offensive further north. The battles of Metz, Fort Driant, and the German counteroffensive attempt against Patton using the new German Panzer Brigades would all be here. Smaller scenarios would allow the players to game smaller periods of time in each of the four months making up the campaign. The game would mate to Wacht am Rhein (2012), allowing more options for both simulations. 4 maps, 16 counter sheets

217198.name: Campaign for North Africa
217198.description:
Description from the publisher:

There is no paperwork or data tracking in the remake of the SPI classic; streamlined but realistic procedures allow the realistic portrayal of unit assignment and supply expenditure. Command and control cards drive the action, enabling a player to tailor his emphasis on building units, gathering intelligence, conducting operations, or building up supplies. The map has been given a graphic update. The air war is updated and enhanced and the OOB presents the latest research with all units at a battalion level (armor in companies and air units in squadrons). Now it's the ultimate North Africa simulation.

217199.name: Austerlitz, 2 December 1805
217199.description:
Description from the publihser:

Napoleon's most decisive victory was brought about by a successful French deception causing the Coalition armies to overextend their lines. This game would recreate the uncertainty faced by both sides with variable deployment, hidden entry, and optional orders of battle. Four maps, seven counter sheets.

217200.name: Free Mars
217200.description:
Description from the publisher:

From the colonies of Mars to the orbital stations of Earth and to the outposts on Jupiter, the cry is heard, Free Mars! is a science fiction wargame of revolt across the Solar System in the late 21st century.

Earth’s colonies are rising up against an oppressive Terran Federation. The system is based on SPI’s Battlefleet Mars, but with additional forces and units representing several types of spaceships, ground units and special forces.

Special weapons include artificial intelligence missiles, cybernetic attacks and enhancement of human warriors via nano-technology. Cards representing the various military-political-economic groups that are maneuvering for power are included. The map shows the Solar System out to Jupiter, with displays for each planet. Two maps, two counter sheets, two card decks.

217201.name: D-Day at Iwo Jima
217201.description:
Description from the publisher:

Two-plus USMC divisions drive to clear the volcanic island. Smaller scenarios for Mount Suribachi and the Amphitheater would be included. Rules for Japanese banzai charges and the tunnel network would be created to show the nature of fighting on this volcanic island. One mounted map board, two counter sheets (352 counters), 55 cards, full color play aid cards, and a 48-page full color rules booklet.

217202.name: Operation Mars
217202.description:
Description from the publisher:

Zhukov’s Grand offensive to destroy the German 9th Army still at the gates of Moscow. It would encompass the battles centered around Rzhev. Smaller scenarios would depict the offensive on both the western and eastern sides of the Rzhev Salient, while the larger campaign scenarios would show the operation in a larger scope using multiple maps. 4-6 map game with 16 counter sheets.

217203.name: Quatre-Bras, 16 June 1815
217203.description:
Two days before Waterloo, the French left wing under Mashal Ney encountered Wellington's army at the crossroads of Quatre Bras. Unknown to Ney, he faced only a thin line of troops as the bulk of Wellington's army raced to the front.

Uncertainty, compounded by conflicting orders from Napoleon, delayed the French advance for several critical hours. Both sides need a quick victory to enable intervention, perhaps decisive, at Ligny, where Napoleon and Blucher have come to grips. Multiple strategy choices for both sides ensure an element of doubt. Two maps, three counter sheets.

217204.name: Planet Explorer
217204.description:
Players try to manipulate the movement of the shared space ship to avoid the space pirates and to land on the planets of the solar system.

In order to land, the players need to have collected the resources required for that specific planet.

At the end of the game, the player who collected the most points from experience certificates is the winner.

217205.name: Star Force Alpha Centauri
217205.description:
Description from the publisher:

Star Force Alpha Centauri covers the initial human penetration into interstellar space, with the map showing the local group of stars in three dimensions. This will have several different races of sentient beings, each with their own psychology, reflected in different capabilities and objectives. Game units will include: star forces (four ships each), star gates, and star soldier strike commands.

There will also be some specialized units, such as local forces of varying capability, weapons packs for star forces, and nova inducing conversion bombs for when things get really desperate.

A deck of cards will generate specialized capabilities for each sentient race as well as game events, allowing for the linking of individual scenarios into one grand game. One mounted map, card stock ships and stands, wood/plastic markers, one deck of cards.

217206.name: The Wandering of the Peoples: The Voelkerwanderung
217206.description:
Description from the publisher:

This is Euro-style game set in the mid-5th century AD. The map covers the Western Roman Empire from the Rhine and Danube River lines west to Latetia (modern-day Paris) and south to Rome.

Each chief attempts to win by being the first to lead one of his tribes into the heart of the empire, the fabulous city of Rome. Along the way, each will find his progress slowed by determined Roman legions, plagues, the chicanery of the gods, and perhaps even the backstabbing diplomacy of his comrades.

No player is ever eliminated before the end of the game, and even the last-place person can come quickly come from behind to win at the last minute. A game of alliance, betrayal, and maneuver, it’s easily played in under an hour by anyone age 10 or older.

217207.description:
Description from the publisher:

The soldiers of the Steel Guard are battle-hardened veterans who have been gravely wounded in combat. These guys now have the chance to fight again, thanks to the latest Sino-Soviet Union technology for human enhancement. Their broken bodies are placed into a steel sarcophagus, which becomes their sanctuary. It keeps them alive and, most of all, keeps them fighting for the Motherland.
217207.name: Dust Tactics: Steel Guard Fire Support Squad – "Steel  Wall"

217208.name: Frankia
217208.description:
Description from the publisher:

This is an historical game for three or four players. Each of the eight Rounds represents a long period of northwestern European medieval history, from 20 to 75 years. This game uses a simplified and shortened version of the systems developed for the game Britannia. Each turn, the player moves and attacks with new factions in an effort to score points by achieving that faction’s goals.

There are three scenarios, starting in 406 AD (Merovingian Rise), 843 AD (Carolingian Collapse), and 1215 AD (Rise of the Nation-state). The Merovingian Rise scenario follows the barbarian assumption of power from the decrepit West Roman Empire, including the rise of the Merovingian dynasty and the succession of the Carolingian dynasty. It ends with the era of Charlemagne (Charles the Great), the new western Emperor.

The Carolingian Collapse scenario, which chronicles the collapse of the empire built by Charlemagne and his father and grandfather. The scenario begins in 843 AD with the Treaty of Verdun dividing the Frankish empire following the death of Charlemagne’s son, emperor Louis “the Pious,” and ends in 1215, the date of the great Battle of Bouvines.

The three-player Rise of the Nation-State that begins in 1215 is a relatively static situation. Many of the nations can be seen as the precursors of modern states such as Britain, France, Italy, Spain, and Germany.

217209.name: Company Clash
217209.description:
Description from the publisher:

Company Clash is a deck-building game representing the clash between two historical Civil War companies on the fringe of a greater battle.

The game pits a Union and Confederate company against each other across a battle mat where two hands are drawn and committed simultaneously.

Players manipulate cards that include a Start deck from which officers and non-commissioned officers are drawn, a Faction deck to recruit troops, artillery, sharpshooters and battle flags, and a Generic deck to recruit terrain, troops and a variety of combat options. Initiative as well as victory is based on morale.

217210.name: Banana Wars (1898-1935)
217210.description:
Description from the publisher:

US intervention in Latin-America involved the US Marine Corps, Army and Navy. Caribbean nations were invaded, occupied, and sometimes native politicians deposed. Battles with native rebels were frequent. Protecting and promoting economic concerns lay at the root of US military intervention. Businesses such as the United Fruit Company and the Standard Fruit Company sought to control the Caribbean banana, sugar and tobacco trade. Our doughboys became their enforcers.

Banana Wars is a delightful, card-driven whack-a-mole game in which the US player stamps out insurrections while the Insurrecto player creates an unending string of crises to exhaust US resources.

217211.name: Rails to Victory
217211.description:
Description from the publisher:

Take charge of America’s World War II struggle to run its railroads so as to win the war most quickly and efficiently.

Players vie to build a rail system that can move the most men, weapons and supplies needed for the Allies to win in the European and Pacific Theaters of Operations.

Objectives for each turn are generated by Operation cards (such as the buildups for D-Day and the Manhattan Project). The design is based on actual World War II US Army railroad doctrinal publications, and the map is divided into the historic transportation zones, showing critical cities and track lines.

The game can be played by two-to-six, and cooperation becomes necessary because, if certain operational requirements are not fulfilled, the Axis wins World War II and the players lose.

217212.name: Reise um die Erde
217212.description: Where will your travel take you? With an around-the-world ticket in Reise um die Erde, the players fly to the metropolises of the world and share their experiences through social networks? Who will be the first to visit their eight personal dream goals?

217213.name: The Realm
217213.description:
The Realm Online, originally known simply as The Realm, is a second generation MORPG (multiplayer online role playing game).

The Realm was launched in December 1996 for Windows PC. It was designed in the tradition of graphical MUDs, before the popular usage of the terms "massively multiplayer" and "MMORPG".

Originally published by Sierra On-Line, it was abandoned by that company because of its unfavorable comparison to Ultima Online and EverQuest. It was next taken up for a short time by a company called World Opponent Network which was also owned by Sierra On-line, then Codemasters, and presently is a Norseman Games production.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Realm_Online The Realm Online]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217214.name: Take-A-Break! Crosswords for Windows
217214.description:
Description from back of box

The leader is crossword puzzle fun.

750 mind-bending crossword puzzles -- choose your level of difficulty; Apprentice, Puzzler or Fanatic.

217215.name: YO! Fish
217215.description:
Yo Fish! is a game for 3 or 4 players and involves laying cards in a grid and scoring points based on adjacencies.

Needed to play:
Deck of 48 cards, 4 score cards and 8 wooden cubes

Setup:
1. Give each player a score card and two cubes. Players place one cube on the 0 space of their score tracks and keep the other aside for later scoring in the tens columns of the score track.

2. Shuffle the deck of 48 cards and remove the following number of cards from the game:

3 players - remove 6 cards
4 players - remove 5 cards

3. Deal 6 cards to each player. Place the remaining cards in a draw pile. Draw three cards from the draw deck and place them in the center of the table with a card space between each.

4. The youngest player is the Starting Player.

To Win:
Have the most victory points at the end of the game.

Play:
Beginning with the Starting Player, and proceeding clockwise, players may take one of two actions on their turn:

1. Play a card face up and adjacent (left or right, above or below) to any previously played cards in the playing area. For each card that is adjacent to the card played (left or right, above or below), and matches the color of the played card, gain one victory point. If none of the adjacent cards match in color, gain victory points equal to the value of the played card.

2. Play a card face up on top of a previously played card. These cards must never match in color and the card being played must have a higher value than the one it is covering. Gain victory points equal to the sum of both cards (the card played and the one below it) and then remove both cards from the game.

The current player then draws a new card from the draw deck to place in their hand. If the draw deck is empty, the player will not draw a new card. It is now the turn of the player to their left.

Game End:
After all players have played their last card and their hands are empty, the player with the most victory points is declared the winner and all the fish can yo!

Advanced Game:
Before the game begins, deal one card to each player from those removed during setup. These cards will be kept hidden by players during the game. At the end of the game each player will receive additional victory points equal to the largest number of adjacent cards whose color matches the player’s hidden card. Two or more players may have the same hidden card color.

217216.name: Teen Heroes and Adolescent Villains
217216.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon has new heroes and bad guys for your HWM games. Yep ten new character too add to the excitement of your favorite super hero system. This time around we have ten teenage heroes and super villains, all filled with teen angst and teen power.

The book also comes with a full color figure flat of each character and a full color image to show then off to the players.

Inside you will find…

Fire Girl, a psychopath that can burn you.
Radar, she has always wanted to be a superhero and has the gadgets to make it work.
Striker, a trained assassin with a need to change his life for the better.
Cybernaut, a cyborg hero.
Tritonia, a mermaid with a heart of gold.
Flip, a girl that can really get the job done and a hero to boot.
Titan, He packs a punch and a great hero in the making.
Disc, a alien hero.
Orb, the twin brother of Disc.
Blind, a cute, but blind psychic.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217217.name: Breaking Point
217217.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

From the introduction:

The hallmark of a true hero is what happens when the going gets tough. With lives at stake and no one else to do the job, will you press on to the bitter end, or will you reach your breaking point?

A Sheldomar Valley Metaregional adventure for APLs 6 – 18.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217218.name: Dark Clouds Over Istivin
217218.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Adventure

From the introduction:

The hallmark of a true hero is what happens when the going gets tough. With lives at stake and no one else to do the job, will you press on to the bitter end, or will you reach your breaking point?

A Sheldomar Valley Metaregional adventure for APLs 6 – 18.

217219.name: Above and Below - Track 1 High
rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217219.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Interactive

From the introduction:

The Court of the Land calls you to battle! The mercenary lord Drakhmar builds an ever-growing force in service to the Spider Queen and only a daring assault can burn the web of shadow that threatens all of the Sheldomar.

A combat-intensive Sheldomar metaregional battle and delve interactive for APLs 4-14 and an interlude in the "Shadows over the Sheldomar" series.

It is strongly recommended that PCs play SHE7-06: A Topaz is Forever before participating in this event.

217220.name: Above and Below - Track 1 Low
rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217220.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Interactive

From the introduction:

The Court of the Land calls you to battle! The mercenary lord Drakhmar builds an ever-growing force in service to the Spider Queen and only a daring assault can burn the web of shadow that threatens all of the Sheldomar.

A combat-intensive Sheldomar metaregional battle and delve interactive for APLs 4-14 and an interlude in the "Shadows over the Sheldomar" series.

It is strongly recommended that PCs play SHE7-06: A Topaz is Forever before participating in this event.

217221.name: Above and Below - Track 2 High
rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217221.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Interactive

From the introduction:

The Court of the Land calls you to battle! The mercenary lord Drakhmar builds an ever-growing force in service to the Spider Queen and only a daring assault can burn the web of shadow that threatens all of the Sheldomar.

A combat-intensive Sheldomar metaregional battle and delve interactive for APLs 4-14 and an interlude in the "Shadows over the Sheldomar" series.

It is strongly recommended that PCs play SHE7-06: A Topaz is Forever before participating in this event.

217222.name: Above and Below - Track 2 Low
rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217222.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Interactive

From the introduction:

The Court of the Land calls you to battle! The mercenary lord Drakhmar builds an ever-growing force in service to the Spider Queen and only a daring assault can burn the web of shadow that threatens all of the Sheldomar.

A combat-intensive Sheldomar metaregional battle and delve interactive for APLs 4-14 and an interlude in the "Shadows over the Sheldomar" series.

It is strongly recommended that PCs play SHE7-06: A Topaz is Forever before participating in this event.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217223.name: Domino Theory
217223.description:
A One- or Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Metaregional Interactive

From the introduction:

"Soldiers, adventurers, sellswords and volunteers!" intones the grim-faced half-elven Knight of Luna. "We have learned that the Pomarj forces currently running amok in the Suss stage out from the area surrounding the ghost-ridden ruins of Nol-Daer. We march today to break their camps and crush their army. This must be done" he rumbles, "at any cost."

A one or two round variable length Sheldomar Valley Metaregional battle interactive for APLs 2-14 and Part 5 of the Secrets of the Suss Series.

Racially diverse parties are recommended.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217224.name: Rangers Lead the Way (Senior DM)
217224.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Battle Interactive

From the introduction:

The forces of the Pomarj have long held a critical strategic asset on the Jewel River, forcing the Principality of Ulek and its allies to fight around their position, but not for much longer. A plan has been conceived, a battle set - and you are to be the point of the spear. Come stand against the enemy and strike a blow for the Reclamation!

This document is a resource for the Senior DM of the Interactive.

A two-round intensive Sheldomar Valley Metaregional adventure for APLs 2-14, and Part of the Reclamation series.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217225.name: Rangers Lead the Way (Night Falls)
217225.description:
One Encounter of a Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Battle Interactive

From the introduction:

A Sheldomar Valley metaregional adventure for APLs 2-14, and Part of the Reclamation series.

This adventure will be of particular interest to characters who are sleeping in camp.

rpgseries: SHE - Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Meta-Regional Adventures
217226.name: Rangers Lead the Way (Round 2)
217226.description:
A Two-Round Living Greyhawk Sheldomar Valley Battle Interactive

From the introduction:

The forces of the Pomarj have long held a critical strategic asset on the Jewel River, forcing the Principality of Ulek and its allies to fight around their position, but not for much longer. A plan has been conceived, a battle set - and you are to be the point of the spear. Come stand against the enemy and strike a blow for the Reclamation!

This document is for APL 2-16.

A two-round intensive Sheldomar Valley Metaregional adventure for APLs 2-14, and Part of the Reclamation series.

Note: This adventure will be of particular interest to military and those interested in reclaiming the Disputed Territories.

rpgseries: SND - Living Greyhawk Sunndi Regional Adventures
217227.name: The Onnwalian Envoy
217227.description:
A Living Greyhawk Sunndi Mini-Module Adventure

From the introduction:

Onnwal has send in secret an envoy to Sunndi to discuss any official involvement of Sunndi in the liberation of Onnwal. The Scarlet Brotherhood already tried to stop the envoy from reaching Sunndi in Onnwal once before. Will they try it again in Sunndi?

This mini-module is part several mini modules that involves the first inter-regional plotline for the Sunndi. It is the sequel to The Envoy, a mini-module played within Onnwal.

A Sunndi regional mini-module for Levels 1-8.

217229.name: Ubongo Junior 3-D
217229.description: In Ubongo Junior 3-D, all players compete simultaneously to cover their playing area as quickly as possible with the 3D building blocks. No box can be left uncovered, and nothing can be placed beyond the edges. Once this has been done, race to build the tallest possible jungle tower. After 90 seconds, time is up! Now everyone measures their tower with the giraffe to see how many precious stones they get. Who can collect the most gems?

217230.description: The Walking Pet is a card game where you play as a movie director in charge of selecting the best actors to make movies
217230.name: The Walking Pet

217231.name: Yserbius
217231.description:
User Summary

This retail edition of Sierra's online graphical MUD (originally part of the company's ImagiNation dial-up service) includes the first two installments of the Yserbius trilogy:

- The Shadow of Yserbius
- The Fates of Twinion

217232.name: Gruselgrütze
217232.description: Gruselgrütze is a cooperative children's game that invites players to cook grotesque gourmet food with Witch Hazel from magical ingredients. The one-of-a-kind magic spreader passes from hand to hand, but treat it with care or else, POOF, the whole mixture explodes!

217233.name: Chicken Wings: Glow in the Dark
217233.description:
The chickens are becoming more and more inventive and are now ready to attempt to break out at night since they now glow in the dark.

Chicken Wings: Glow in the Dark is a new version of Chicken Wings that includes new tiles for more fun.

217234.name: Haste Worte? Jubiläumsedition
217234.description:
Haste Worte? is a party/word game in which each turn players have 30 seconds to write as many answers as possible for the category or question that round. After 30 seconds pass, players must bid on how many unique answers they have on their list. Bids are revealed simultaneously with the player having the lowest bid reading their answers first. Any answer already named gets crossed off a player's list before they get a chance to take their turn. Players score points equal to their bids if they succeed, and the first player to make it around the game board wins.

Haste Worte? Jubiläumsedition features the same gameplay as Haste Worte? and includes forty new cards compared to the original edition.

217235.name: Pfannen-Pannen
217235.description:
There's a lot of hustle and bustle in the restaurant kitchen since hungry guests are waiting for their orders and each of them seems to want something different: spaghetti, fish, pancakes, and more! Who can keep track of who wants what and sizzle the most dishes quickly?

In Pfannen-Pannen, the player chefs need to flip the food tiles in the pans until the desired dish for each guest is in a pan and ready to serve...

217236.name: Crawling Under A Broken Moon (Issue 17 - Feb 2017)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
217236.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the 17th issue of Crawling Under A Broken Moon, a fanzine dedicated to bringing gonzo post apocalyptic content for the Dungeon Crawl Classics RPG from Goodman Games.

This issue contains:

The Necromancers of the Space Needle and the Land of the Reanimatronic Dead

NecroTech - wondrous items brought to you by cutting edge necromancy

The Wikinomicon - containing a pair of spells to die for

And a slew of new undead beasties to kill your players with

217238.name: Kanji Game
217238.description:
A card game for teaching or learning Japanese kanji!
How to play: Each player receives 5 cards initially. The first player puts a card on the table, then the next player has to choose a card with a kanji that either has the same reading, the same radical or that forms a new word with the last opened card. If a card cannot be played the player draws another card. The first player to play all their cards win.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217239.name: Flying Column 1
217239.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

User summary:

The "Jaeger" (adventuring party) is sent to the northeast to scout and harass the enemy.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217240.name: Flying Column 2
217240.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

User summary:

The "Jaeger" (adventuring party) is sent to the east to scout and harass the enemy.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217241.name: Flying Column 3
217241.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

User summary:

The "Jaeger" (adventuring party) is sent to the southeast to scout and harass the enemy.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217242.name: Mission to Sedhane
217242.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Thus it is you find yourselves assigned to the task of warning and assisting the evacuation of the town of Sedhane.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217243.name: Race Ahead 1
217243.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your Jaeger has been assigned the following: Race ahead of the main column back up the trail to the monastery of St. Cuthbert’s. Along the way you are to clear any threats to the rest of the retreat.

User summary:

Apparently two similar "race ahead" missions were contemplated, though only one was designed and played.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217244.name: Mission to Illanoff
217244.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Thus it is you find yourselves assigned to the task of warning and assisting the evacuation of the town of Illanof.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217245.name: Mission to Singler's Dell
217245.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Thus it is you find yourselves assigned to the task of warning and assisting the evacuation of the town of Shingler's Dell.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217246.name: Medi-Vac One
217246.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Being quite obvious to enemy eyes, head back up the Kershane Pass to St Cuthberts as a decoy medical evacuation. The plan being that this will draw enemy attention away from the true evacuation train.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217247.name: Medi-Vac Two
217247.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Being quite obvious to enemy eyes, head back up the Kershane Pass to St Cuthberts as a decoy medical evacuation. The plan being that this will draw enemy attention away from the true evacuation train.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217248.name: Supply Train
217248.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

You are to covertly ship out four crates of very valuable bless weapon vials (200 in all) back to the monastery. They will be vital for the defense.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217249.name: Right Flank
217249.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

You Jaeger is to move along the right (Northern) side of the Kershane valley up the slopes a little and intercept any of the enemy who may be moving along the upper trails.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217250.name: Left Flank
217250.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

You Jaeger is to move along the left (Southern) side of the Kershane valley up the slopes a little and intercept any of the enemy who may be moving along the upper trails.

217251.name: Le quiz de comment
217251.description:
Le quiz de comment (The How? quiz) is an educational trivia game aimed for kids.
Each player starts with 7 cards in 7 different categories. The goal of the game is to get rid of the cards a quickly as possible and score most points.

One by one the players play out a card with either a solo or group question. The solo question has to be answered by the player. If right he scores a point, otherwise he draws a new card of the same category.
All players can try to answer the group question simultaneously. The quickest scores two points. If a person gives a wrong answer he draws a new card.

The game ends when a player has no cards left. The one with most points wins the game.

217253.name: Labyrint 2.0
boardgameintegration: Labyrint
Labyrint Flip
Labyrint
Labyrint Flip
217253.description:
Description from the publisher:

A new version of the popular Labyrinth game! The game includes 4 new challenges:
Collect "livspuckar" in the labyrinth
Find the correct path through the sewer
Outsmart the Minus robot and pass the slime-tunnel
Be the first one to solve the gear-puzzle.

The game is either stand-alone, or it can be used together with either the first Labyrint game or the Labyrint-Flip.

217257.name: Animal P-P-P-Pickup
217257.description:
Description from the designer:

A quick microgame of picking animals from a grid to score the most points from various sets. Where you take from on your turn directly affects which cards your opponent can choose from on their turn. Choose wisely to gain the best sets, and avoid the potentially dangerous/unwanted animals!

The game uses a 4*4 grid of cards, with 2 'arrow' cards (one per player) pointing to a row and a column respectively. On each player's turn, they move their arrow card to a new row/column and take the card in the grid pointed to by both arrow cards. Most cards have varying types of set-collection scoring opportunities; others have special actions to swap cards or discard cards.

Once all cards in the grid have been taken, the player with the most points wins!

217260.name: Troubling Events
217260.description:
From the adventures premise ...

Set in the city of Yahleui, the heroes have only recently come to the continent of Crimhuck, seeking adventure. The heroes are met by a large comely woman in a tavern called the “Winding Trail”, her name is Hilde. She tells them that if they can safely get a magical ring to her employer deep in the sewers under the city they will be rewarded with precious gemstones.

217261.description:
To celebrate the twentieth anniversary of Bohnanza, designer Uwe Rosenberg and publisher AMIGO Spiel have released a special edition of the game appropriately titled Bohnanza: 20 Jahre.

The rules for play are the same as those of Bohnanza: Players start with a hand of bean cards, and they cannot change the order of cards in their hand! Each bean card has a number that indicates how many cards of that type are in the deck, as well as a "beanometer" on the bottom of the card that tells you how many Talers you earn when you harvest those beans from your field. The more beans of a type that you have, the more Talers you earn.

On a turn, a player must plant the first card in hand into one of their fields, and they may plant the second card. All cards in a field must be of the same type. The player then reveals two cards from the deck and optionally trades those cards and cards in their hand with cards in the hands of other players; all traded cards must be planted, not returned to hand. Players can trade cards from anywhere in their hand, and doing so lets you set up good plays in future turns. To end a turn, a player draws cards and places them at the back of their hand. You can harvest a field at any time to collect Talers, keeping some cards to represent these coins and returning others to the discard pile to be recycled when the deck is shuffled.

Bohnanza: 20 Jahre adds one new type of bean to the game: the spring bean. Whenever a player harvests two spring beans, they draw cards from the deck equal to one more than the number of players. They plant one of these cards for themselves, then pass the cards around the table so that each other player can do the same. The final card is returned to the active player, who keeps it for a Taler.
217261.name: Bohnanza: 20 Jahre

217262.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells VI (PRD)
217262.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

217263.name: Cleric/Oracle Spells VI (3PP)
217263.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Cleric/Oracle Spells is a simple document that collects the cleric/oracle spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 6th-level cleric/oracle spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

217264.name: Enigmatic Arcanary - Arcane Trickster Archetypes
217264.description:
From publisher blurb:

The arcane trickster, the prestige class first presented in 3.5 combined the rogue's ability to damage others through stealth and subterfuge while taking advantage of the powers of an arcane spell-caster. While carried forward into Paizo's Pathfinder Roleplaying Game, prestige classes have been supplanted by archetypes and then later by hybrid classes. This issue of the Player Paraphernalia introduces several new archetypes for various classes built upon the ideas and concepts of the arcane trickster including the enigmatic adept, fetch, frenetic bomber, orphic sleuth, and prevaricator. This issue also includes a new sorcerer bloodline also built upon arcane trickster and two new alchemist discoveries.

217265.description:
Description from the designer:

Organizing an appealing carnival parade is not an easy task. To play a beautiful role on the parade, the job in the shed of samba schools must be arduous and only the most competent players will succeed!

The game Ziriguidum brings the challenge behind the scenes of organizing a samba school parade, in a very thematic, fun and strategic way. Players need to make the right decisions about design and execution of the sections of their school, about the amount of tests, solving unexpected events, always seeking to please the judges in order to get the best ratings at the end of the parade.

Ziriguidum is a eurogame of medium complexity, which entertains both casual and experienced players. Its main mechanicss are card drafting and hand management. The game supports 2 to 6 players, and lasts about 60 minutes.

Prepare your costumes and tambourines to make a unique and impressive spetacle!
217265.name: Ziriguidum

217266.name: Scorched Earth
217266.description:
From publisher blurb:

Scorched is an adventure roleplaying game inspired by Mad Max, Fallout, and a long line of gritty post-apocalyptic fiction. This is a game of survival and chaos, a world where society has broken down and life is a struggle. Post-apocalyptic America is rife with madness and death, radiation and sickness, famine and war. The players take on the roles of survivors or adventurers, those seeking to plunder their enemies, right great wrongs, rebuild the world, or simply live until the next day.

In addition to new classes, races, items, and rules, Scorched Earth introduces vehicles as a major fixture of gameplay. Seamlessly blend gunplay and explosions with high stakes car chases and collisions. In the wasteland, a good motor can be just as valuable as a reliable weapon.

Scorched Earth uses the Pathfinder rules system and requires the Pathfinder Core Rulebook to play. The information provided in this book exists to give players the tools they need to create characters who survive in post-apocalyptic America.

217267.name: Scorched Earth: American Wastelands
217267.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the New America

This is a land of death and strife, starvation and chaos. Murderers roam free, unfettered by morals or legal consequence. Radioactive monsters consume the unprepared and innocent. Insane scavengers protect glowing specks of land with unwarranted violence.

The few beacons of stability are nearly as bad. In the east, a madman drugs the water supply and sacrifices children for his entertainment. In the south, extreme religious fanaticism grips a monolith from the past. In the west, a deadly car race determines superiority over kin. And scattered all across this great wasteland are pockets of survivors and raiders, scavengers and soldiers, individuals and families on the brink of destruction.

The Scorched Earth Campaign Setting serves as campaign setting, bestiary, and NPC codex.

These tools, in conjunction with the rules found in the Scorched Earth Core rulebook provide the setting, enemies, and rules needed to run a full Scorched Earth game.

Welcome to the American Wasteland. Welcome to the Scorched Earth.

217268.description:
Description from the designer:

Wyścig Odkrywców ("Discoverer's Race") is board game which takes place in 1900. Main goal is to win race around the world and collect as much as possible discoveries and treasures from various places. There are 22 secret locations in game and 20 artifacts.

Game has few great features;

Each player can chose 1 character he will lead. Every character has his bio, statistics which have great impact on every situation player can encounter. There are 6 characters to chose. Each character has 5 stats (Cleverness, Wisdom, Diplomacy, Strength, Navigation)





During his travel, player can also use a lot of equipment to enhance abilities of his character. These tools are located on markets around the globe, but once they are obtained, they can give new options to a player.



Many of treasures can be sold. Currency is strong point of the game; walking on foot around globe is not good idea, so player can chose transport with Carriage, Caravan, Train or Ship. Those trips costs - and you can earn money sending your character to work in city.



Game uses two systems created by Jaroslaw Bilinski: TnE and Ocean, which - combined, give great feel and increase players control over his character and actions he takes in-game.



In some cities player can hire guide and mercenaries to protect him while hi travel to some location. But such party costs a lot of money –not every character in game is suitable to walk alone into desert without proper gear.


Basically, you chose what you like: be it exploring jungle or dig in Piramids, but be sure you have good stats for either, or at least tools and equipment!
217268.name: Wyścig Odkrywców

217269.name: Let's Go Sugaring
217269.description:
Very simple childrens/family cooperative game.
Theme of the game is springtime maple sugaring season.

At the start of the game, the game owner shuffles well and places all 16 cards (depicting either pails, a sap collector or bad weather) face down in the 16 spaces around the perimeter of the board. In the middle of the board are 9 spaces depicting tapped trees. Off the board, but within reach of all players, are 16 small plastic pails.

On a players turn, (owner goes first) one of the 16 cards is turned face up. The action that card shows affects all 3 center spaces in the direction the arrow on the board is showing.
SAP PAILS: (depicting 1 to 3 pails) place plastic pails in number
shown anywhere on those 3 spaces. You can never have
more than 4 pails on one space.
SAP COLLECTOR: player takes all pails in the direction of the
arrow, and places them in front of him.
BAD WEATHER: remove all pails in the direction of the arrow, and
put them back in the general supply.

The winner is the player with the most sap pails after all 16 cards have been turned over.

Game instructions also include information about maple syrup.

217270.description: Kamasutra is a freely downloadable web-published print-and-play adult party game. Every round, a random kamasutra position is drawn, and each couple must assume the position, then push against one another to pop the balloon placed between them. The first couple to break the balloon scores the point and takes the card.
217270.name: Kamasutra
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 90- The Oracle of Delphi and Wisdom Check 4 (with Stephen Buonocore, plus CONTEST)

217271.name: Skunk!!!
217271.description:
Simple childrens/family cooperative game where you try to keep your organic garden safe from pests, while trying to catch as many of them as you can.

The game consists of a 12"X 12" board made up of nine different numbered garden patches, 7 cardboard garden pests numbered 1-6, paperboard havahart trap, 2 dice and electric fence chart (used in harder game play).

Setup: put pests on the board in the matching black numbered/picture patch of the garden. The skunk starts the game off the board next to the number 1 space. Oldest player goes first.

A turn consists of the following actions:
1. Put the open trap on any garden patch
2. Roll both dice to see which pests move.
A pest is moved to its matching picture. Back and forth between its black numbered space and the bottom row of the garden with red-numbered picture/spaces. A 1 rolled, moves both a pest, AND moves the skunk onto the board. The skunk only moves on a 1, and follows the green dotted path through the garden.

If a pest ends up in the trap at the end of a turn, it is caught and moved off the board. It CAN re-enter the game if doubles of their number are rolled! Skunks cannot be removed from the board.

The game ends when all the pests have been caught and are off the board, OR the skunk moves through all 9 garden patches and leaves the garden.

If the skunks departure ends the game, count up how many pests you got rid of, and try for more next time!

217272.name: Unbound
217272.description:
[Taken from the back cover.]

INFINITE ADVENTURES IN NUMBERLESS WORLDS

Unbound is a universal roleplaying game with a twist: the players and the gamesmaster create the world, the plot, and the adversaries during character creation. Using a series of leading questions and a rule system that lets players fill the gaps with their imagination, you'll craft a unique setting together - and then get out there and explore it!

Unbound supports short, linked campaigns and has an innovative, fast-paced combat system that puts pressure on the players to make tactical decisions every turn. To play Unbound, you'll need a group of 3 to 6 players, a gamesmaster, and one deck of regular playing cards per player.

[From the publisher site.]
From the creator of Goblin Quest, One Last Job, Drunken Bear Fighter and more besides comes UNBOUND, a new tabletop roleplaying game. Co-written by Grant Howitt and Chris Taylor, UNBOUND is a mix of streamlined tactical combat and collaborative worldbuilding and storytelling. UNBOUND allows the players and gamesmaster the chance to craft the characters, the adventure and the game world together, all at the same time, through a series of directed prompts and leading questions tied to the powers and abilities that players choose for their characters.

We’ve played in games featuring cyberpunk bodyhorror noir, drunk jungle wizards, dwarven robocops, young adult guerilla warfare, post-apocalyptic sci-fi dragonhunters and biomechanical high elf assault vampires. We can’t wait to see what worlds you’ll create together.

UNBOUND is low-prep, high-content. With UNBOUND, the players and the GM contribute evenly to the story, so – in the in very first session, and every session after that – there’s a bare minimum of preparation. Everyone just turns up and plays: less planning, more awesome.

UNBOUND’s battle system is fluid and cinematic but supports interesting, round-to-round tactical decisions through a series of clever abstractions and an innovative stamina system. Using a deck of standard playing cards as both a way to determine chance and each character’s hitpoints, we’ve built a visceral and exciting way to have fights.

217273.name: Slicer
217273.description:
Entry into the 2017 9 Card Nanogame Contest

You are an elite hacker known as a 'slicer'. You have recently targeted The Corporation as a prime target. Your goal is simple, find and compromise their database. Armed with your trust cyberdeck and your program routines, you must act quickly before you are detected in The Corporations system. Will you be successful or will the defense prove too much for you to overcome?

Slicer is a Solitaire game using cards to represent The Corporate's assets arranged in different grid patterns. Using blue discs as a time keeping mechanism, you will reveal cards, defeat the assets using a D6 and the orange discs to help ensure success by augmenting rolls, or allowing for a re-roll.

217275.name: Kakerlaken-Duell
217275.description:
As in every duel, players in Kakerlaken Duell sit opposite one another. Between them is a game board on which stand exactly four cockroaches in four rows. On a turn, one player sets up the stones in front of themselves, one per row with the symbol facing themselves; the other player then reveals one or more of these stones. Can you trick your opponent in making the wrong choices? Can you read their mind while keeping yours hidden?

Whoever first lures one of the cockroaches to their side of the board wins!

217276.name: The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen (3rd Edition)
rpg: The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen
217276.description:
(From back of the book)

Baron Munchausen's tales of his extraordinary adventures are legendary: riding cannonballs through the air, sailing to the Moon, meeting gods, escaping from the Turkish Army on half a horse, and many others.
Can you outdo the Baron? You can try!
Challenge your friends to tell the most extraordinary tale, interrupt to correct their boasts, and share your own amazing exploits in this renowned game of wit, riposte, and repartee, written in high style by the Baron himself. Expect no dice, counters, or pencils while playing, just fine wine and great merriment. Time to charge your glass and begin your tale!
This third edition of The Extraordinary Adventures of Baron Munchausen is massively expanded with new and revised material. Contained within is the original game along with Arabian style rules from Sinbad the Sailor, a simpler version for younger (or inebriated) players, and rules for online games. One of the Baron's own descendants has also added twelve new variants of the game, allowing for stories where villains concoct dastardly schemes, ancient gods return from watery depths, heroic adventurers fight evil empires in outer space, and more!

boardgamecompilation: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines
Sentinels of the Multiverse: Wrath of the Cosmos
217278.description:
Sentinels of the Multiverse expansions Shattered Timelines and Wrath of the Cosmos boxed together. This was printed first for Everything Ever+ backers of the Sentinels of the Multiverse: Oblivaeon kickstarter.

Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines features two new time-traveling heroes, four villains (some of which may be familiar to Sentinels fans), and two time-displaced environments! Besides just expanding the number of characters and environments available to players, Shattered Timelines introduces new mechanisms and exciting new challenges. Can you repair time before it runs out?!

The far-reaches of space have converged on the earth! In Sentinels of the Multiverse: Wrath of the Cosmos, heroes must join forces to defend the world from threats from beyond our galaxy. This expansion includes two cosmic heroes, four destructive villains, and two far-flung environments.

The Cosmos are leaving their mark on the Multiverse! Do you have what it takes to save the earth from the impending annihilation? Stand and fight for your planet!
217278.name: Sentinels of the Multiverse: Shattered Timelines & Wrath of the Cosmos

217279.name: Crimson Nights
217279.description:
Crimson Nights is a Multiplayer Dungeon Crawler Video Game.

Source: The Game Website.

217280.name: Artillerists
217280.description:
Artillerists is a turn-based isometric strategy. You should destroy the enemy’s armed forces, capture territories, earn money and upgrade your army. In addition to the main types of units and weapons, player can use radar reconnaissance, volley fire, air strikes, artillery strikes and many others...

Source: The Game Website.

217281.name: Hawks Tactical
217281.description:
User Summary

Hawk and his friends have sworn to defend their village because the king was too weak to do it.

217282.name: Your Star
217282.description:
In the game, you control a young boy who need to explore a strange mansion to find his sister and escape the place.

Source: The Developer Website.

217283.name: Celestial Breach
217283.description:
Celestial Breach is a Coop arcade flight game in a Sci-Fi setting, Focused on team play VS NPC. It contains a lots of the old school arcade flight sim components, while being refreshing by focusing on cooperation and adding more exotic weapons, abilities, and GamePlay mechanics.

Source: The Game Website.

217284.name: Isolation
217284.description:
User Summary

The plague destroyed the world you once knew. This unknown bacteria destroyed the lives of many people who lived in various countries around the world.

217285.name: Blink the Bulb
217285.description:
User Summary

Blink the Bulb is a 16-bit platformer composed of massive, holiday-themed realms.

217286.name: Joyland
217286.description:
People are going missing all over a Mississippi swamp, a massive reward is offered for the suspected giant gator. Bounty Hunters from around the world flood in to compete for the prize, but what they find unites them as the hunters become the hunted.

Joyland is a Co-op game for 2-5 players ages 12 and up. 1-4 players control Bounty Hunters and one player controls Shiv The Killer Clown.

Players face 4 phases all with different objectives. 2 phases take place "above ground" in the park (board one) and 2 phases occur below ground in the "Freak Show" caverns (board 2).

In order to "win" players must reach Shiv and defeat him.

217287.name: Godless
217287.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drown in Fire and Blood!

After the Cataclysm sundered our world, reducing cities to ruins and bringing nations to their knees, a new threat unfurled its wings to cast a shadow upon our reality. In this spreading gloom caper demons, warped creatures, and horrifying monsters, all of which tear down what’s left of the world in preparation for the coming of their dark master, the dreaded Demon Lord.

Godless is a new setting expansion for Shadow of the Demon Lord, giving you all the tools you need to transform our own planet into the World of Fire and Blood. This book contains:

Guidance for using Shadow’s ancestries in this new setting, plus a new take on the clockwork: the transcendent!
More interesting things, training elements for novice paths, and strange new religions
New expert paths such as the preacher and road warrior
An assortment of spells useful for surviving in such a bleak setting
New weapons, armor, gear, and vehicles
New rules for building items from salvage, using automatic weapons, and handling desperate battles fought from speeding vehicles
Extensive advice for transforming our planet into your very own World of Fire and Blood
New relics such as the Boomstick and new creatures such as the steel skeleton and the unseen




With Godless, you have everything you need to adapt Shadow of the Demon Lord for play in a post-apocalyptic environment, letting the players create characters who scavenge the landscape for parts, food, and fuel, while fighting off hideous mutants, invaders from other realities, and, of course, demons. With this book, you’ll be able to explore a brand new world in the grip of the dreaded Demon Lord!

217288.name: Enigmatis 3: The Shadow of Karkhala
217288.description:
Enigmatis: The Shadow of Karkhala is the final chapter in the blockbuster trilogy: an exciting detective story rife with adventure, puzzles, and ancient mystery.

The ultimate hidden object adventure begins!

The demonic preacher has escaped to the remotest mountains in pursuit of a grim secret that could give him ultimate power. He has already eluded the investigation of the protagonist detective and her partner Hamilton twice: once in Maple Creek, and again in Ravenwood. It’s no mystery that this time it’s personal.

43 hand-drawn locations full of HO scenes!

After returning to Maple Creek and uncovering new evidence about the preacher’s enigmatic plan, the two detectives set out in search of a centuries-old monastery hidden high in the breathtaking mountains where the immortal preacher’s lifelong quest for world domination could finally meet its sinister end.

Exciting 25 mini games and puzzles set in the Karakorum Mountains!

What is hiding in the ancient monastery that clings to upper reaches of the snow-covered mountain? What nightmarish secret is the preacher looking for there?

Fantastic detective story rich in eerie mysteries!

Drawn into this ancient struggle between the forces of light and darkness, the detective must defeat the ominous preacher at any cost. Will they even be able to stop him now that he’s more powerful than ever before?

More mini games and puzzles in the bonus adventure!

Play the Blood on the Snow prequel to the main game for more storylines and even more mysteries and hidden object scenes!

Bring the hidden object puzzle adventure with you!

Optimized for phones and tablets, filled with hidden objects, perfect for playing while traveling. No Wi-Fi required for this offline game!

Source: The Publisher Website.

217289.name: Altered Earth: Heroic Tier Threats
217289.description:
From publisher blurb:

A great collection of foes and threats for your AE games. Packed full of mutants, androids and crazy enemies, this little gem of gaming goodness will take your AE games to the next level.

217290.name: Cities of Altered Earth: Consortium
217290.description:
From publisher blurb:

Located near the Inland Sea, Consortium is the largest city in the world. Nearly a quarter of a billion people struggle to survive in this vast maze of concrete and steel. The impoverished hordes are crammed into enormous habitation complexes while the political elite look down on their empire from above. Consortium is a city of fear, where order is kept through automated gun turrets and even thinking the wrong way could attract the attention of the secret police.

Consortium is not a place for the faint of heart. Those who have the right combination of cunning and bravery will find that opportunities for adventure abound, those who falter are destined for reeducation or worse.

This PDF contains:
-History and general layout of the city
-Encounter groups for the police and military
-Information on criminal organizations and outlawed religious sects

A must have for all you Altered Earth fans.

217291.name: Cities of Altered Earth: Octagon
217291.description:
From publisher blurb:

Built deep in the Western Mountains, the mega-city called Octagon is a paradise for the idle rich and a living hell for the sweating masses. A chaotic mass of skyscrapers and mega-pyramids looms above the ruins of the old city, and terrible secrets lurk in the subterranean depths below. Octagon the place where elections and trials are run like reality shows, and corporate executives settle disputes through gladiatorial combat.

Octagon is a city full of both opportunity and danger. From the lawless streets of lowtown to the deceptively beautiful gardens of the penthouse level, adventure awaits those who are desperate or foolish enough to chase after it.

This PDF contains:
-History and general layout of the city
-Encounter groups for different areas
-Information on the most prominent factions in Octagon

A must have for all you Altered Earth fans.

217292.name: Picross 3D: Round 2
217292.description:
Nintendo's Website: Chip away at a three-dimensional block puzzle to reveal the object hidden within. Only this time, blocks can be painted with two colors of paint to mold detailed shapes. Enjoy more than 300 puzzles at the Cafe or even tap compatible amiibo figures to solve 10 more puzzles hiding secret Nintendo characters!

Source: The Publisher Website.

217293.name: To the Edge of the Map (4E)
217293.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Tale of Terrible Danger

A Monster From Prehistoric Times

An Impossible Quest

“To the Edge of the Map” is the first installment of a classic fantasy adventure series called Slayers of the Great Serpent. The story begins when a messenger arrives at the royal court with a warning of apocalyptic magnitude. A terrible menace that is about to awaken; heroes are needed to cross the ocean and travel to the distant East in order to search for the lair of a gargantuan snake known as The Destroyer and The Eater of Worlds. These heroes must travel far from their homes, and try to find the country where the Great Serpent lives. Very little is known about this land, save for rumors that it lies to the east of distant Xi, a strange and romantic kingdom on the other side of the ocean. Nothing will be certain on this journey, not the final destination of our heroes, or the incredible dangers that they are sure to face. If no one can find this monster and lay it low before it rises from its torpor then the world will fall into an age of darkness and become transformed into a nightmarish hellscape of misery and death.

The majority of this adventure takes place while the adventurers are traveling; they must contend with both the everyday hazards of life on the road as well as cowardly plots initiated by an agent of the Church of the Destroyer. Before they can think about crossing the ocean, the adventurers must first find and reach the coast of their own continent. The first task they will need to accomplish is to leave the borders of The Kingdom by the Sea and then cross the dangerous Iron Ridge Mountains. On the other side of these mountains the adventurers will encounter a violent and lawless region known as The Outlaw Kingdoms. Should they make it across this land and yet live, they must still face the unknown dangers of the enchanted Forest of Night. It is here that the adventurers will brave a final showdown with the mysterious agent that has impaired their progress from the start. During the confrontation, the cultist summons a horrific Nightmare Snake, a living fragment of one of the Great Serpent’s dreams.

217294.name: To the Edge of the Map (Pathfinder)
217294.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Tale of Terrible Danger

A Monster From Prehistoric Times

An Impossible Quest

“To the Edge of the Map” is the first installment of a classic fantasy adventure series called Slayers of the Great Serpent. The story begins when a messenger arrives at the royal court with a warning of apocalyptic magnitude. A terrible menace that is about to awaken; heroes are needed to cross the ocean and travel to the distant East in order to search for the lair of a gargantuan snake known as The Destroyer and The Eater of Worlds. These heroes must travel far from their homes, and try to find the country where the Great Serpent lives. Very little is known about this land, save for rumors that it lies to the east of distant Xi, a strange and romantic kingdom on the other side of the ocean. Nothing will be certain on this journey, not the final destination of our heroes, or the incredible dangers that they are sure to face. If no one can find this monster and lay it low before it rises from its torpor then the world will fall into an age of darkness and become transformed into a nightmarish hellscape of misery and death.

The majority of this adventure takes place while the adventurers are traveling; they must contend with both the everyday hazards of life on the road as well as cowardly plots initiated by an agent of the Church of the Destroyer. Before they can think about crossing the ocean, the adventurers must first find and reach the coast of their own continent. The first task they will need to accomplish is to leave the borders of The Kingdom by the Sea and then cross the dangerous Iron Ridge Mountains. On the other side of these mountains the adventurers will encounter a violent and lawless region known as The Outlaw Kingdoms. Should they make it across this land and yet live, they must still face the unknown dangers of the enchanted Forest of Night. It is here that the adventurers will brave a final showdown with the mysterious agent that has impaired their progress from the start. During the confrontation, the cultist summons a horrific Nightmare Snake, a living fragment of one of the Great Serpent’s dreams.

217295.name: To the Edge of the Map Extras (Pathfinder)
217295.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to add to your adventure, well get these extras for Slayers of the Great Serpent. Included is a great map of the adventure, player's handouts and a character sheet.Want to add to your adventure, well get these extras for Slayers of the Great Serpent. Included is a great map of the adventure, player's handouts and a character sheet.

217296.name: To the Edge of the Map Extras (4E)
217296.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to add to your adventure, well get these extras for Slayers of the Great Serpent. Included is a great map of the adventure, player's handouts and a character sheet.

217297.name: Beyond the Forest of Night (4E)
217297.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Beyond the Forest of Night" is the second installment of a classic fantasy adventure series called Slayers of the Great Serpent. The vision behind the Slayers of the Great Serpent series is about creating a story about heroes and their great deeds, but also about making a world that is majestic and awe-inspiring. This is a quest that requires the party to travel far beyond the lands known to them and cross half the world, witnessing many bizarre and spectacular sights and facing many dangers.

In this adventure, the heroes must cross the dangerous Snow Drake River at the only safe passage, a bridge fort that is currently besieged by an evil baroness. The lord of the keep tells them of a secret, but terribly dangerous, crossing point. The heroes also learn that the route to the port city of Syrn involves traveling through a vile and dangerous landscape known as the Swamp of Woe and Lost Hope. The only man known to have entered the swamp and returned to tell the tale is a woodsman named Byrnes, who is currently incarcerated in the infamous Prison at Burning Claw. The party may be tempted to free the unjustly held rustic in order to gain information about the horrid swamp.

After making their way through the dreadful Swamp of Woe and Lost Hope, the heroes arrive in the bustling and hectic metropolis of Syrn. They make inquiries about obtaining passage on a ship heading to the exotic east, and are told of a captain who boasts that his route through the Spice Islands and bordering lands takes him within sight of the fabled nation of Xi. However, a mysterious carnival and a slave revolt complicate matters.

217298.name: Anansi and the Box of Stories
217298.description:
A story, a story; let it come, let it go. Once, all the stories belonged to someone else, but now they belong to Anansi, the Trickster — which is a story unto itself! Everyone knows that the best stories happen when you play someone else for the fool. But sometimes, even the best of tricks can backfire, and who plays the fool then?

In Anansi and the Box of Stories, the players take on the roles of archetypal animals in a trick-taking game in which you can use your animal cunning and abilities to turn the tricks in your favor. Each round, every player plays the card they think will win the trick. But beware, as others will turn your tricks back on you and make you a fool, taking away your points! Only a player who can skillfully win tricks without being made a fool will prove their wisdom.

217299.description:
Kolejka: Gamers' Deck is a small-sized expansion that includes 24 new cards. The deck is playable with Kolejka or Ogonek (with cards to play with six players). The cards were developed by Kolejka fans Magdalena Andrałojć, Jadwiga Spyrka, Krzysztof Latosiński and Jarosław Pawel and tested by designer Karol Madaj.

Kolejka: Gamers' Deck was added to Polish magazine Kurier Planszowy, and the artwork on the cards was drawn by the original Kolejka artist.
217299.name: Kolejka: Gamers' Deck

217302.name: Planeta Nomino
217302.description:
Story:

April 2053. A group of space explorers arrives distant planet Nomino. On the spot they discover numerous mysterious objects. Nobody knows what is the purpose of the items they encountered. Yet, the astronauts have to give discoveries appropriate names as soon as possible due to the request of the mighty press syndicate being a sponsor of the expedition. The public is waiting for more news about expedition findings and scientists, threatened by news mogul with financial cuts, must act quickly…

Overview:

“Planet Nomino” is a family party game where players match bizarre names to even stranger objects.

In each round the players reveal a thing, put the spinning top in motion and then discuss the best names for it. In order to win player may need to convince other researchers that one of the picks is the best (even if it is obviously the worst one!). As soon as the spinning top stopped, they vote for each proposal and score according to the result of the ballot.

There are two modes of play: Simple, for young scientists, and basic, for more experienced astronauts.

In simple mode the player gets the points if she or he voted for most popular name (the one, which according to player’s opinion fits the object best and thus got majority of the votes).

In basic mode there is one more twist added. Each player gets each round new character card. Each character pursues own secret agenda and gains points if specific names had or had not been used (even if these were better choices than others).

The game continues until a player reaches 7 victory points.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217303.name: Through the Shroud
217303.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

An officer of the watch arrives and humbly requests your attendance at the to a briefing with the garrison commander VanOotsl.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217304.name: Fan of Arrows (Fire)
217304.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your escort takes you through to the briefing room where you see that other Jaeger team leaders are also present. VanOotsl is standing conferring with Herzog Roodenhuis the new commander of Madriga’s Jaegars and they look up as you enter, give respectful nods and indicate the side-board to help yourselves to mulled wine.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217305.name: Fan of Arrows (Air)
217305.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your escort takes you through to the briefing room where you see that other Jaeger team leaders are also present. VanOotsl is standing conferring with Herzog Roodenhuis the new commander of Madriga’s Jaegars and they look up as you enter, give respectful nods and indicate the side-board to help yourselves to mulled wine.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217306.name: Fan of Arrows (Water)
217306.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your escort takes you through to the briefing room where you see that other Jaeger team leaders are also present. VanOotsl is standing conferring with Herzog Roodenhuis the new commander of Madriga’s Jaegars and they look up as you enter, give respectful nods and indicate the side-board to help yourselves to mulled wine.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217307.name: Fan of Arrows (Earth)
217307.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your escort takes you through to the briefing room where you see that other Jaeger team leaders are also present. VanOotsl is standing conferring with Herzog Roodenhuis the new commander of Madriga’s Jaegars and they look up as you enter, give respectful nods and indicate the side-board to help yourselves to mulled wine.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217308.name: Unholy Alliance
217308.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

From the introduction:

Your escort takes you through to the briefing room where you see that other Jaeger team leaders are also present. VanOotsl is standing conferring with Herzog Roodenhuis the new commander of Madriga’s Jaegars and they look up as you enter, give respectful nods and indicate the side-board to help yourselves to mulled wine.

217309.name: NOCT
217309.description:
Noct is a 2d top-down multiplayer survival horror game that blends arcade combat with rpg survival elements. You are a survivor of the apocalyptic purge that formed the desolate wasteland now known as noct.

Source: The Game Website.

217310.name: [NM 156]
217310.description:
From publisher blurb:

We are Paragons, enforcers of justice, living in the utopia of the Grand Society. Terrorists seeking to spread fear and panic live among us. They threaten the Grand Society by sowing discontent and seeking to destroy everything we hold as good and right and true. If they had it their way there would be no reincarnation, they would force us all to face the final death; oblivion. As Paragons it is our duty to protect our families, ensure the existence of our community, by facing what others must not be forced to face. Our faith in the Grand Society is peerless, it is for this reason we can stand up to those unbelievers, the Sinners, who would destroy everything and everyone we love. No one is above our scrutiny — even those closest to us — ensuring this insidious disease does not spread.

In [NM 156], players take on the roles of Paragons — enforcers of utopian rule, charged with ensuring none disrupt the Grand Society’s perfection. People who rebel against the status quo threaten the society’s values, spreading fear and panic. They are Sinners and it is the Paragons’ task to capture them, even if Paragons have become Sinners.

No one is above the law.

217311.name: The Last 12 Hours
217311.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Last 12 Hours tells the stories of small-time criminals, innocent dupes, and the ironic hand of fate that throws them into circumstances beyond their control. It’s the world of Reservoir Dogs and Blood Simple, the world of Cormac McCarthy and William Lindsay Gresham. It’s the world where the good and the not-so-good have to face the ugly consequences of things they did (and didn’t do) in a very short about of time. It’s a world of violence, desperation, and survival at all costs… and like the characters being played, the players won’t have anyone to guide them but themselves.

The Last 12 Hours is a story roleplaying game. It is a GMless game in which the participants portray characters without a gamemaster controlling things. The outcome of given actions and the overall path that the character take is determined by the choices the players make. This game is designed to move the storyline forward without a single participant’s veto power.

217312.name: Heaven's Collapse
217312.description:
From publisher blurb:

Heaven’s Collapse is a story roleplaying game set in a fantasy world during a tumultuous war. Players take on the roles of advisors, courtiers, missionaries, and non-combatants trying to survive in the capital city, while occupiers slaughter civilians trapped outside the walls. I’ve provided a basic history and background to the scenario, but also given you enough flexibility to transpose it to your own fantasy RPG kingdom. Slight adjustments to the names and personalities of the characters involved are all it takes to make Heaven’s Collapse work in any fantasy setting.

To make game play easy, context about the world and characters is slowly introduced during play though the story cards. When the game starts, little information about the society and characters is provided. As the scenes progress, more and more about the world is revealed: its politics, its major players, and the history that led it to this terrible place and time.

rpgseries: A Nation Mocked II: The Silence of the Damned
217313.name: Defense of the Monastery
217313.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Interactive Adventure

User summary:

This series finale is not well documented. General comments exist in several organizational documents and spreadsheets, including a document of opponents and basic strategies. After the primary scenario completes, a general summing up session concludes the entire series.

217314.name: Forget Me Not: Murder Hobo
217314.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forget-Me-Not (FMN) is a progressive roleplaying game experience that plays in about three hours, though longer games are an option. It can be played with or without a gamemaster, but requires at least three players.

“In the remote town of Ironhome, the Black Dragon Inn attracts many adventurers. Nearby stands the fabled Dark Dungeon, where treasure and glory await for those brave enough. But what happens when the drinks at the inn are just too good and it’s easier to tell stories about the time you entered the dungeon, rather than actually going in…”

217315.name: Sweet Tooth
217315.description:
From publisher blurb:

The evildoer spotlight is a new Saturday Morning Tabletop RPG series of short books (5-10 pages), introducing knew enemies, animals and other antagonists. Included in every book will be a brief summary of the evildoer, their character traits and possible plot hooks to tie that evildoer into an adventure, and of course their stats.

Bonus material will also be included in each evildoer spotlight. The nature of the bonus material may be a new magic item, a supporting cast of weaker evildoers or even a new evildoer trait to add to the list of traits found in the evildoer toolkit at the end of the core rule book.

Book #1: Sweet Tooth

Sweet tooth is a bandit boss who leads his bandit gang, doing bandit things. All while trying to impress . . . “the ladies” . . .

Included in this spotlight is Sweet Tooth & 8 other types of bandit’s, better known as his gang.

Sweet Tooth and his gang make good antagonists for level 1-6 characters. When combining every asset that Sweet Tooth has at his disposal (especially Tallulah), he and his gang can still remain a threat to level 7-8 characters as well.

217316.name: Lecker Mammut!
217316.description:
It's time to hunt lots of delicious mammoth to prove which primeval genes still reside in us. Are we descendants of a legendary chieftain, or were our ancestors simply common members of the tribe? Whenever prey appears, you need to tighten your grip on the club because morality is known only after eating, and a catch is never fully safe from the greedy fingers of the other tribes.

All the cards in Lecker Mammut! are distributed evenly among the players, who stack them face down before them. The starting player of the round begins revealing cards from their stack one by one face up in the middle of the table. As soon as three of the same animals are revealed or three animals of any type in front of the same background, players must race to hit them, with the fastest hunter collecting all cards that match and placing them face up in front of them.
