Avoiding hte many ancient defence mechanisms you must enter the Caverns and deliver the supplies. Any mining instalation requiring supplies will be displaying a red flashing light. Local flight control restruvtions allow you only to land on the yellow landing strips. Once you have supplied five depots you will need to return to the surface to restock with supplies.

217447.name: Tembo
217447.description:
Description from the publisher:

It is one of the Earth's most breathtaking natural spectacles! Every year millions of gnus, zebras and antelopes pass the Mara River in Africa. Water means life — but it also holds danger as crocodiles and lions lie in wait. What luck that there are tembos (elephants) who will help the animals to get safely to the other shore.

Tembo is an awesome game, as exciting and wonderful as Africa itself!

217448.name: Drawing From Life Enhancements
217448.description:
User summary:

After the scenario PAL2-01: Drawing From Life was distributed for play, the author made several comments, suggestions, and errata (including additional player handouts) available in this document.

217449.description:
Numbers aren't worth anything in NMBR 9 unless they're off the ground floor and looking down from above.

The game includes twenty cards numbered 0-9 twice and eighty tiles numbered 0-9; each number tile is composed of squares in some arrangement. After shuffling the deck of cards, draw and reveal the first card. Each player takes a number tile matching the card and places it on the table. With each new card drawn after that, each player takes the appropriate number tile, then adds it to the tiles that they already have in play, with each player building their own arrangement of tiles.

The new tile must touch at least one other tile on the same level along one side of a square. A tile can also be placed on top of two or more other tiles as long as no part of the new tile overhangs the tiles below it; new tiles placed on this same level must touch at least one other tile, while also covering parts of at least two tiles and not overhanging.

Once all the cards have been drawn and the tiles placed, players take turns calculating their score. A tile on the bottom level — the 0th level, if you will — scores 0 points; a tile on the 1st level above this is worth as many points as the number on the tile; a tile on the 2nd level is worth twice the number on the tile; etc. Whoever scores the most points wins!
217449.name: NMBR 9

217450.name: Fighter Pilot
videogameversion: Spanish ZX Spectrum Investronica tape edition
Spanish ZX Spectrum Zafiro tape edition (orange cover)
Spanish ZX Spectrum Zafiro/Z-Cobra tape edition (blue cover)
ZX Spectrum Byte Back tape edition
217450.description:
From cover
Only the best will become a FIGHTER PILOT... climb into the seat of the world's most exciting aircraft and prepare for take-off. Stunning 3-D graphics, air-to-air combat, and fully aerobatic performance put the challenge of real-time flight simulation at your fingertips. Based upon the F15 USAF air superiority jet fighter.
The supreme simulation...
It leaves the rest at the runway threshold.

217451.name: Rapid Fire
217451.description:
From cassette cover
An abandoned warehouse is being used as a hideout by a notorious gang of criminals. As an undercover cop you must find a way into the warehouse, deactivate the computer system, destroy the building, and eliminate any criminals you come across. All action game requiring all your survival skills.

217453.name: Rainbow: Thunder tile
217453.description:
For buyers at the Tokyo Game Market Dec 2016, an additional tile "Thunder" was added as a give away to create even more variety.

Rules:
The Thunder tile is flipped over and shuffled to the other 9 tiles, so the starting grid changes from a 3x3 grid to a 3-4-3 grid.
When you turn over the Thunder tile, the player to your left may randomly draw and keep one of your completed rainbow cards (unless you only own one card, or none).
If more then 3 cloud cards were flipped over, they are shuffled and put back to the other cloud cards keeping the general layout.
If 3 or less cloud cards were flipped over, these are shuffled with additional randomly chosen cloud cards in a total of 4 cards and then all put back to the general layout.

217454.name: Heat Wave: Offshore Superboat Racing
217454.description:
From cover
They rumble like thunder in the distance. The unmistakable sound of 3200 horsepower ripping apart a calm sea.
The Superboarts are coming.
HEAT WAVE: OFFSHORE SUPERBOAT RACING puts you at the helm of 4 naurical thoroughbreds as you compete on a circuit of realistic, three-dimensional courses.
A fast fleet of 4 computer skippers stands between you and the most prestigious title in all of powerboat racing: US 1-best in the world. Buckle your life west. It's going to be a bumpy ride.

217455.name: Hero of the Golden Talisman
217455.description:
From inlay
Far, far away, beyond the mists of time and space there is a great cit which was protected from the forces of evil by the Golden Talisman. Death and destruction now hang over the city where the 5 pieces of the Talisman are scattered in a forbiffing labyrinth guarded by the lost soul of your predecessors, reincarnated as monsters.
You must find your way through the maze if tunnels and underground watercourses collecting objects in your way. You need spells as well as continuous firepower to destroy the firebreathing dragons.
Before diving into the deep pools, ensure you have enough air and remember you can only climb out onto the hanging ropes.
Your skll and courage can piece together the Talisman, find the ecil Wizard who has cursed the city and release the people from their torment.

217456.name: Foghorn Nightmare
217456.description:
1+ Co-Op survival horror.

Players control survivors who wake up in the nightmarish town of Foghorn. Filled with various monsters, you must collect supplies and weapons to fight your way through the night. Can you survive until dawn? Can you escape the horrors of the town? Fight through asylums, schools, the meat factory and other horrific places as monsters hunt you. Build barricades, help other survivors for supplies. Kick doors down and fight for survival. Will you be the hunted, or the hunter?

Set in the 1980's and like a classic horror movie there are dozens of survival horror weapons to choose from but are you lucky and brave enough to find them?

Choose your survivors, each with their own strengths and weaknesses. Each with their own unique skills and starting weapon. Work alone or fight together and try to resist the madness that is slowly turning your survivor into another monster.

The game is played on a D12 (12 sided dice). Standard melee attacks are 5+ to hit but some survivors have better melee skills. Shooting is standard 5+ too. There is no shooting distance negative. Each survivor gets 5 actions for things like movement, shooting, building barricades etc. There are dozens of weapons but only 1 and some 2 of each scattered around found in crates and given by in game story survivor's on successful missions. Plus most melee weapons breaks after an 10 uses and most monsters require 3-4 hits each so stocking up is Essential. There is also limited ammo supplies to be found. You can build special weapons too like a spear if you have tape, knife and a pole cue. Most weapons and supplies are found in crates around the map. Break them open and take the said amount from the equipment card pile.

Helping in game survivors can gain you more weapons. Read the story card objective the survivor has task you with and complete in a certain amount of turns. Failing will result in the in game survivor turning mad. You then have the fight him. Killing him you can then take his supplies found on him but you will not get the crate of good stuff as he never told your where it was located.

Standard game is 10 missions. Your survivors have a certain amount of wounds each, some have 18 other 23-28. Having a tougher survivor does not mean the are better, instead sacrificing wounds for better accuracy or agility to avoid taking hits. The Paratrooper is excellent at shooting and tough as nails but he is not as fast at running but someone like the Actress has few wounds but is very agile meaning its easy for her to avoid taking hits plus she can hide easier is sneaking around avoiding those horrid beasts.

Some monsters require light to die so carrying a torch is ideal. Other are messed up real bad by fire and others have longer reach meaning they can attack your from further away and also ignore barricades by simple walking along the wall or roof.

The movement is played in inches. Some can move 4 inch per action or 5. You can not run past enemies if they are within 1 inch and others have long arms so even more difficult to run past. The monsters are played by the game.

Starting the game you have 1 survivor and as time goes on you unlock more playable survivors as the story goes on and you can trade weapons etc with them if next to them. Each player starts with 1 survivor and same goes, unlock more throughout the missions.

Each survivor has their standard attack without weapons but they can attack like head butt or kick etc for a more powerful or multiple target attack but have to roll higher on the D12. They also have a sanity attack which is a special powerful attack. To get a sanity attack you must kill the enemy. Some require 12 kills other 16 etc.

Madness is a thing that slowly affect your survivor throughout the game. Collect Essene by killing monsters to slow your madness or find essence statues through the map. Going mad puts your character in the mad room were you have to fight your own demons. In the mad room you don't use the weapons you have collected instead you take new cards for this 1 mission. Completing the mad room puts you back in the game with your prevous weapons, supplies. To lose to the madness means you characters becomes a monster and hunts your other survivors. He is now controlled by the game.

Over all the co-op or 1 player experience is a story game were after completing each small mission you have a few turns to roam and find supplies etc. Then you take another story card and your next objective begins to completing your over all mission of escaping and surviving until sunrise.

There are various difficulty modes. Easy mode grants you a shop which you can buy new weapons and weapon mods like a silencer, scope plus supplies. Money is spent via sanity and madness points. Spending madness increases your madness and sanity spends sanity points meaning you have to kill more monsters to get your sanity attack back.

Normal mode does not have the shop and Nightmare mode has more monsters and less weapons / supplies. There is also the serial killer mode which you play a killer. The problem is his madness degrades faster but you can choose to kill other survivors for a big halt or kill monsters for a small halt to the madness.

217457.name: War Zone Vector 1
217457.description:
Who is the greatest special forces unit? Take control of your elite 5 28mm operatives and go head to head against another 5 special forces team.

First up is the U.K. SAS against the US Navy Seals. 28mm miniatures play on a 45" by 45" board map which can be made smaller and is included or play of a terrain table.

Each operative has their special skills and best suited fighting style. Command elite CQB units with their SMG and Shotguns. Head shot the enemy with your sniper. Suppress them with your machine gunner and blast them with your rifleman's grenade launcher. And don't forget, your unique Op. swap out or use your specialist depending on the team which could be a flame thrower or anti material sniper or perhaps at PDW etc.

More teams will become available like the Royal Marines Commandos, the Spetsnaz, the US Army Green Berets and many more.

And don't forget the expansion, Zombies. Put your 5 members against a zombie infested town with various zombie types.

Feeling historical. Let go WW2 with your British Commandos, Waffen SS, Japanese Para Marines, the US Airborne, Russians and Chinese.

Build a deck too and kit out your ops with various skills and equipment.

Each player takes 3 cards and places them onto each Commandos dash board but keep them secret from the other players. Example of cards are tactics and equipment e.g. Kill box tactic, which means your unit will open fire on the first enemy unit to cross his line of sight. Kill box is used in the enemies turn meaning the enemy player has the risk of being shot at as he does not know if your unit as the kill box card. Another example is grenades. Your unit could be carrying a smoke grenade and HE grenade on top of their standard equipment. A standard CQB operator for say comes with a SMG and shotgun plus a flash bang and grenade. So you could kit him up with extra grenades or medi packs etc with the extra equipment cards.

The game is played with a D12 (12 sided dice). Each unit in the attackers turn has 5 actions each and the player uses them how he wants eg move, shot, reload, use rocket launcher etc. Some actions like rocket launcher cost 2 actions. The defending player also get to use actions in their turn but only 3 and only if shot at or attacked. Example if your shotgunner fires and hit or misses, the defender gets options. The defender can shot back, run, run and shot or charge. Each option has various negative and more negatives if your unit happened to be hit. Running for say means he can run to cover if in range as each member can only move 3-4-5 inches per action depending on their equipment load. If running then the attacker can choose to shot again but at -1 accuracy to the roll. The defender can use 1 action up to 3 action per defence turn. If he is attacked a 4th time then he can do nothing about it.

Each unit has 10 wounds unless the have the skill Airborne which gives them 11 wounds. Face shots take off 2 wounds. Being hit in the arm twice will decrease accuracy. Legs 2 twice decreases movement. Having only 1 wound left means your unit can only crawl and lay. Laying down or kneeing however increases your defence meaning the attacker has -1 or -2 to his accuracy when rolling to hit. Medi packs increases wounds by 2.

Reloading is required for every 3 shots and cost 1 action. Changing weapons like taking out a pistol cost 1 action unless you have the transition skill meaning it costs nothing to swap weapons.

The game is highly tactical and there are various distances for weapons. Point blank. Close range. Short range. Medium. Long and extreme. Some weapons can not shot into long and extreme like shot guns etc.

Standard mission is kill the enemy team.
Embassy siege is an Expansion which gives you 20 bad guys and hostages. Basically rescue the hostages. You can also play this as bank robbery too or town take over. Kill the bad guys.

Zombie is another Expansion. 3 missions. Your unit is trapped with minimal weapons and you can open crates found for better, extra weapons and escape. Or mission 2, storm the town and kill the zombies. There are various zombie types with different abilities and strengths. Or play the wave mission also.

217458.name: Xenoshyft: Forbidden Sciences
217458.description:
The Forbidden Sciences expansion includes all-new Division Cards for the Psychogenics Lab and Grafting Research divisions, as well as five all-new items for both Divisions, adding a wealth of new variety to your games!

Bring out the untapped potential of the human mind with the Psychogenics Lab!

Turn your Troops into horrifying (but effective) alien/human hybrids with the Grafting Lab!

Tap into the untold power of The Forbidden Sciences!

217459.name: Hollywood Movie-Bingo
217459.description:
This bingo-style game has a spinner with the letters of the alphabet, and 10 player cards, each bearing the names of three '30s Hollywood stars, one with 5 letters, one with 6 and one with 7.

After each spin, players put tokens on top of all examples of that letter on their card. The first to cover all letters on two of the names on a card shouts "Hollywood". The names are checked and if correct, that player wins; otherwise that player is out of the game and spinning continues. The rules say players may agree to play until all three names on a card are covered.

The cards are a who's who of Depression-era stars: Astaire, Garbo, Chaplin, Gable, Cagney, Hepburn, Karloff, Jolson, Ruggles and many more.

217460.name: Deadliest Empire
217460.description:
Army vs army of historical empires.

Take command of 1 of 3 28mm armies in the 1st core box. Choose the Viking with their fast close combat and Berserker units and shield maidens. Choose the Crusaders with their heavily armoured tank infantry, the Knights Templar's and run down the enemy with their heavy cavalry or choose to rain down on the enemy with the Chinese. Hail storm them with your arrows and Kung Fu monks.

Box set 2 comes with the Roman Legions, the Samurai and the Scottish Highlander's with their huge claymores.

Add mercenaries to your army too. Will you add some British Red Coats, or Musketeers to name a few.

With extra units coming too like the rock throwing Trebuchet, Valkyries, Geisha assassins, Bees nest rocket arrows etc.

Commands powerful Heroes like Thor or Arch Angel Michael or military strategists like Julius Caesar or Sun Tzu.

28mm miniatures

Each unit counts as a large squad with a certain amount of health. Each unit as 3 attack statistics and 3 defense. Martial counts as a units attack speed (how fast they can use their sword). Strength is how powerful your soldier or weapon is. Aggression is how many times your unit can attack per turn so your unit may strike 3 times with a strength of 1 totaling 3 damage. However for defence they enemy unit has agility meaning they may be able to avoid all or some attacks. Toughness may decrease an attacker strength meaning a strength 5 attack against heavy armour toughness 3 possibly equals only receiving 2 damage. The defenders may even attack first if their martial is higher than the attacking units. So attacking someone like Thor wouldn't be wise in close combat has he would likely attack first and with great strength and aggression.

Ranged weapons has 3 stats. Accuracy. Rain and meteor. Rain is mostly for arrows, like a hailstorm of arrows raining down and meteor is for things like big rocks.

You don't roll to hit instead once your within melee range you see who hits first (martial) then calculate how many attacks and some strength minis the defenders agility and toughness.

Melee can change also depending on the formation your units are in. Declare which formation your using and place the formation token next to your unit. The defender also has a chance to change formation depending on how far they are from you and their leadership command skill. Example an arrow head formation from cavalry would decimate a unit of Axe men in a standard line formation. You add the formation score of the successful formation charge to the score of your attack. So attacks in melee for say is 6 damage plus 2 damage for the formation charge totaling 8 damage.

As you units health decrease so does the amount of attack you can perform for that unit. a unit with 10 health at aggression 2 = 20 attacks. if your unit has decreased to health 5 then the total attacks is 10 because have your squad is dead. For heroes it does not decrease as they represent one model.

The game has been designed to be as realistic to ancient combat tactics as possible with many units having various formation choices.

Maybe units has Reach. Reach is like spears and pike. An axe men unit would be hit first by Pikemen even if the Axemen have a higher Martial because the Pikemen have big long spear. Standard Reach is 1 meaning can hit the enemy if within 1 inch. Spear are Reach 2 and Pike are 3 inch hit.

20% of your army can be made up from mercenary units from another army.

At the beginning of the game you also have a certain amount of points to spend on upgrades like flaming arrows, smoke bombs, traps and flaming logs etc. You can buy oil and place it on the battlefield then Use your flaming arrows to light it up. These items are represented by cards. Keep them secret from the other player and use the item when you would like. example 10 points may buy you 1 turns of flaming arrows but 30 points buy you flaming arrows for all turns.

Standard mission is kill the enemy.
Other missions are castle siege etc.

217463.name: Forgotten Traditions
217463.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The origin of runes has long been lost to the majority of sages and wizards, save those with giant blood.

However, with the shattering of the Ordning, the magic of runes has once again emerged into the Realms. Adventurers must delve into a ruined complex beneath the Spine of the World, suspected by SEER to be the birthplace of that arcane tradition.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 5th-10th Level Characters.

217464.name: Durlag's Tower
217464.description:
Publisher's blurb:

East of Beregost, nestled in the outskirts of the Wood of Sharp Teeth, Durlag’s Tower has intrigued and yet stymied adventurers for decades. Stuffed full of mechanical traps and arcane wards, and rumored to be inhabited by fiends, very few have managed to extract any REAL treasure from the former home of Durlag Trollkiller.

However, a powerful item in the ancient fight against the giants is said to be housed there, and the cloud giant Baron Rajiram has committed significant resources toward recovering it. After a pleasant tea in her garden, SEER calls upon you to beat him there and put a stop to his efforts!

A Four-Hour Adventure for 11th – 16th level Characters.

217465.name: Durlag's Tomb
217465.description:
Publisher's blurb:

East of Beregost, nestled in the outskirts of the Wood of Sharp Teeth, Durlag’s Tower has intrigued and yet stymied adventurers for decades. Stuffed full of mechanical traps and arcane wards, and rumored to be inhabited by fiends, very few have managed to extract any REAL treasure from the former home of Durlag Trollkiller.

However, a powerful item in the ancient fight against the giants is said to be housed there, and the cloud giant Baron Rajiram has committed significant resources toward recovering it. After a pleasant tea in her garden, SEER calls upon you to beat him there and put a stop to his efforts!

A 4-Hour Adventure for 11th—16th Level Characters

217466.description: Mafiozoo is a revised version of Rüdiger Dorn's Louis XIV. The biggest difference between this and Louis XIV is that the three levels of mission cards have been replaced by a 4×4 map of influential locations. Instead of playing pairs of tokens to fulfill mission cards and gain their superpower, you play the pairs of tokens to place goons on the locations; and where you place goons can grant you access to place goons in new locations.
217466.name: Mafiozoo

217467.name: Giant Diplomacy
217467.description:
Publisher's blurb:

SEER has learned of an attempt to intimidate Gralm, an ettin, and his followers into joining Bad Fruul’s army.

HSING comes forth to communicate that she wants you to see if you can find some way to either insure Gralm remains neutral, or to encourage the creature to challenge Bad Fruul to single combat in the hopes that he might wrest control of the hill giant’s forces and turn them back from Parnast.

A Two-Hour Adventure for 1st-4th Level Characters,

217468.name: Mare Nostrum: Empires – Starting Heroes
217468.description:
This expansion for Mare Nostrum: Empires adds six new heroes, that may be used in place of the original Starting Heroes. All additional rules are contained on the back of the tiles.

The new heroes provided include: Alexander, Brutus, Gadeirus, Khufu, Mago I and Xerxes.

217470.name: Qwinto: Das Kartenspiel
217470.description:
Qwinto: Das Kartenspiel is a card game version of the dice game Qwinto. As in the original game, players each have an individual score sheet, and they're trying to use numbers (1-18) to fill in the empty spaces in three rows, which are colored orange, yellow and purple. Within a row, lower numbers must be placed to the left of higher numbers, and no number can be repeated. In the two- and three-space columns formed by the rows, no number can be repeated, but numbers can be in any order.

Aside from the score sheet, the game includes 32 cards, with the cards numbered 0-6 and -2 in four colors (yellow, orange, purple, gray). Each player starts with a random hand of three cards, then four cards are laid in a 2x2 square. On a turn, a player lays a card from their and onto one of the cards in the square, then sums that card and the two adjacent cards, stating this number and the color of all non-grey cards out loud, e.g., "13 in purple and yellow". Each player can then write a 13 in either the purple or yellow row on their score sheet. If the number is less than 1 or all the cards are grey, then no one can write anything; if the active player can't write anything on their score sheet, then they must mark a penalty box instead.

If a player has two cards with the same number, they can lay down one of them, then the matching number in an adjacent space, thus possibly changing the sum drastically. A player refills their hand to three cards to end their turn.

When a player has completely filled two rows with numbers or all four penalty spaces on their score sheet, the game ends. Each player tallies the points for each of their rows: 1 point per number if spaces are empty, or as many points as the rightmost number if the row is full. For each three-space column, if all spaces are filled, then the player scores points equal to the number in the pentagon. For each penalty point, the player loses 5 points. Whoever has the highest sum wins!

boardgameintegration: DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash
DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light
DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light – Collector's Box
DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men - Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men – Set Up Box
Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War
Marvel Dice Masters: Deadpool
Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man
Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters
Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters
DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash
DC Comics Dice Masters: Justice League
DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light
DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light – Collector's Box
DC Comics Dice Masters: World's Finest
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Battle for Faerûn
Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Faerûn Under Siege
Marvel Dice Masters: Age of Ultron
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men - Hawkeye: Avengers Disassembled
Marvel Dice Masters: Avengers vs. X-Men – Set Up Box
Marvel Dice Masters: Civil War
Marvel Dice Masters: Deadpool
Marvel Dice Masters: The Amazing Spider-Man
Marvel Dice Masters: Uncanny X-Men
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters
Yu-Gi-Oh! Dice Masters
217471.description:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell is a dice-building game patterned after Quarriors! that features custom dice representing various characters from the cartoon version of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (TMNT) universe. Unlike other Dice Masters sets, TMNT Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell is sold in as a contained set that gives you all the dice and cards that you need to play.

In the game, each player brings a set of dice to the table; these form the player's team, from which only they can purchase dice. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase them.

During a turn, a player draws and rolls a number of their dice, purchases additional dice, and fields character dice to attack the other player. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

TMNT Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell is one of several planned Dice Masters games, all of which can be intermixed (or played alone).
217471.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Dice Masters: Heroes in a Half Shell

217472.name: Versus
217472.description:
From the Introduction:

A major merchant company in Waterdeep, called 'Berrico Trading Company', has been doing business for years with a merchant group called 'Coster Y', out of Baldurs Gate which is run and owned by a Trellick Amaze. A fairly new merchant company has set up shop in Baldur's Gate and wants to cut out Coster Y, and start doing business with 'Berrico Trading Company'.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters. This scenario file was distributed with eight JPG files (black-and-white maps).

217473.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Wizard’s WARdrobe, you take the role of an apprentice wizard who has busted in to the Grand Wizard’s magical WARdrobe to battle other wizards for epic loot. Each player starts with 99 Hit Points, two learned spells in hand, and a wizard inventory playmat with 8 color & number-coded body locations for items (2 feet, 2 body, 2 hands, 1 head & as many accessories [trinkets or familiars] as you want). During your turn you allocate 3 actions to cast spells, use items, and grab items from the 8 face-up WARdrobe piles. The more powerful the effect, the more actions it costs, so keep an eye out for boots and familiars that can give you extra actions.

Gear Up!
The more items you are wearing, the harder you are to hit. The innovative hit roll system supports the theme nicely: When a wizard deals damage to other wizards, they roll an 8-sided hit die and refer to the hit location on each affected players’ playmat. If the wizard has an item in that location, it is moved to the junk pile and no damage is dealt. If the wizard does not have an item in that location, then the damage is rolled and dealt to the wizard’s HP.

Throw Down!
There is a vast repertoire of offensive and defensive effects in the base game (over 200 cards), with more to come in the preset expansion boosters. Once your wizard is suited up with synergetic buffs, you are ready to use your spells and items to attack your opponents and defend yourself. The last wizard standing wins!

Wizard’s WARdrobe is quick to set up and very easy to learn: the game pieces laid out almost teach the game itself. It is fast-paced (you can start slinging right off the bat) yet still highly strategic (with dozens of spells and 8 WARdrobe piles to choose equipment from, there are many lines of play). So far, in the hundreds of private and public playtests at conventions and stores, almost every game has been unique and exciting. The few games that weren’t we used to refine the game to its current 5th version, which is running super smooth, fun, and balanced.
217473.name: Wizard's WARdrobe

217474.name: Village of the Desecrate Temple
217474.description:
From the Introduction:

Years ago there was a great empire that worshiped the sun. They were mainly neutral-good alignment. They lived nearby and made the temple to worship. The people were happy and thrived. Unfortunately Nomadic warrior tribes came and with them they brought a great plague. The plague wiped out the great empire and left the temple abandoned.

User summary:

For 3rd - 4th level characters. This scenario file was distributed with nine one-page DOC files (each file presents one color map).

217475.name: Twenty One
217475.description:
Each player in Twenty One receives a different score sheet at the start of the game; each sheet has five horizontal rows with six colored dice pictured in each row, and while the numbers are identical in each of the rows on each sheet, the arrangement of colors differs.

To score points, a player needs to fill these dice with numbers, but they have to fill (or mark off) all six dice in a row before they can move to the next row on their score sheet — and to write numbers on their sheet, they'll have to depend (at least somewhat) on the luck of the dice.

On a turn, the active player rolls six colored dice that match the colors depicted on each score sheet. They must keep all 1s that they roll, but they can choose to reroll all non-1 dice twice. After the second roll, all players can use the rolled dice to fill one or more of the dice on their sheet — but only if the die of the matching color shows a value equal to or less than what's on the score sheet.

For example, if your row shows a yellow 6, blue 5, white 4, etc., and you or the active player rolls yellow 3, blue 6, white 4, etc., you can choose to write "3" in the yellow space (earning yourself 3 points at the end of the game), but you may choose not to since you could score up to 6 points for that space. You can't write anything in blue since the die is higher than the number shown. You definitely want to write 4 in the white space since 4 is the most points you can score there. What's more, since you had an exact hit, you "x" the box as well, and you score bonus points in a row for the number of "x"s that you have.

If you can't or don't want to fill in a number, you must cross out the leftmost space in your current row, earning no points for this space. As soon as all spaces in a row are filled or crossed off, you start the next row with the next roll of the dice. The game ends the turn that someone completes the fifth row, after which everyone tallies their points to see who wins.

217476.name: Battle of Saipan 1944
217476.description:
User Summary

Late in the Second World War the Japanese found themselves on the defensive against their numerous American foes. In 1944 the Island of Saipan became the American's next target. From Saipan long range B-29's could bomb the Japanese mainland.

The stakes were high. The player commands the American forces trying to take the island away from the Japanese which are controlled by the artificial intelligence.

This game was created by Joni Nuutinen as part of the Conflict-Series.

217477.name: X-Force
217477.description:
User Summary

X-Force is a side-scrolling shoot'em-up set in space. The game was programmed by Richard Bayliss. The mission is to battle against the aliens of Darx. The game has 16 levels. The game was released on tape and download in different versions.

217478.name: Horror Hospital
217478.description:
User Summary

Are you ready to face fear?

217479.name: Heroes of Dark Dungeon
217479.description:
User Summary

Heroes of Dark Dungeon - it is hack'n'slash Action/RPG with third person view.

217480.name: Milkmaid of the Milky Way
217480.description:
Milkmaid of the Milky Way is a classic point-and-click adventure game in rhyme that combines an exciting story with puzzles and exploration. What happens when a young milkmaid sees an alien craft in a fjord in 1920's Norway?

Source: The Developer Website.

217481.name: Thing-in-Itself
217481.description:
“Thing-in-Itself” is an interactive short story about the struggles of understanding another human being. Using Immanuel Kant’s concept as a framework, it leads the player through stages of a relationship, exploring how perceptions may clash and surroundings can alter.

Source: The Game Website.

217482.name: Pictopix
217482.description:
Pictopix is a puzzle game where you use logic to color squares on grids in order to reveal pictures.

Source: The Developer Website.

217483.name: Don't Chat With Strangers
217483.description:
User Summary

The main character in the middle of the night is approached by a strange girl in an online chat. Don't die and solve the mystery of the girl.

217484.name: Crimson Sword Saga: The Peloran Wars
217484.description:
Crimson Sword Saga: The Peloran Wars is a RPG/visual novel which borrows many popular gameplay elements from series such as Fire Emblem and Langrisser.

Source: The Developer Website.

217485.name: The Swindle
videogameversion: PlayStation 3 / PlayStation 4 / PlayStation Vita Downloadable edition
217485.description:
The Swindle is a steampunk cybercrime caper about breaking into buildings, hacking their systems, stealing all their cash, and quickly running away again before the police show up.

All the buildings you’ll be robbing are randomly-generated, so you’ll never get the same level twice.

Meanwhile, from the safety of your rickety airship up in Outer Space, you can modify your thief with new skills, tools, and all manner of advanced technological horrors, allowing you to take on bigger buildings with better security, for gargantuan rewards!

Source: The Game Website.

217486.name: Ligretto Rockin' Dice
217486.description:
Description from the back of the box:

Players frantically roll their dice at the same time and quickly try to place them on the gameboard, in numerical order. Keep rolling until the right number is rolled The player to place all of his or her dice on the board first wins.

217487.name: Out of Sight
217487.description:
The "out of sight" game to play. For groovy gamers of all ages.

The object is to collect as many marbles as possible without uncovering any of the red dots that are "out of sight"

Marbles are set on all open circles so the red dots underneath cannot be seen. Then a spinner is spun that changes the position of the red dots to unknown areas.

The players spin the "Fickle Finger of Fate" spinner to tell them how many marbles to remove. If a red dot is under the marble, the player must return as many marbles as it takes to cover all the holes.

If the player who uncovered a red dot cannot cover all the open holes, then the game is over and the player with the most marbles wins.

217488.description:
A new of its kind strategy board game for 2 to 6 players. Take your viruses and battle your opponent's occupied cells, but be careful, the cure syringe is also part of the game. Take risks and dominate the game. Challenge your friends and let them Infected.

Featuring built-in neodymium magnet characters and fully magnetized board.

Play Infected in single mode or in team mode with your friends.
Each player takes at the role of one color virus and battles his opponent's occupied cells with the purpose of infecting other player's head viruses to win the game. Avoid the cure miracles, make the right moves to infect cells, take risks and dominate the game. Let your friends Infected.

Infected: The Board Game is not like other games. Here, players don't start in the same place each game played. Infected randomize the way to start each game by spinning the Infected spinning disk and throwing the dice at the beginning of the game.

All viruses start in each player's head virus, so protecting your head virus is something to always keep in mind.
217488.name: Infected: The board game

217489.name: ¡Escándalo! El robo del siglo
217489.description:
A great art exhibition is celebrated. For the first time it has managed to gather in a great exhibition numerous objects, jewels and artworks that until now it had not been possible to contemplate together. This exhibition is assembled for the first time in a museum enabled in The Alhambra Palace (Seville, Spain). Incredible safety deployment, protection systems have been carefully designed.

Among all the pieces featured are five valuable jewels coveted by the world's most famous thieves, who will meet there in an attempt to prove who is the best of them all. They will all try to steal them without being trapped.

No one can enter without jumping the system. No one? ... Nothing can be removed from the museum without being detected. Nothing?...

Penetrate into the Palace of the Alhambra, getting as many jewels as possible and escaping without being discovered is the challenge of the game. Each player becomes a thief for the duration of the game, and must use all his ingenuity to avoid escape the strict security measures that have been put in place to protect the jewels. All the tools and weapons necessary to carry out the stole have been buried in the Palace Gardens: the Arrayanes's Garden and the Lion's Garden, months before the Opening of the Exhibition, and so during the first tour for these two gardens, simulated to be innocent visitors, the players are collecting the necessary equipment.

The only escape route is through the Mosque located in the northwest corner of the Palace, as the Alhambra is surrounded by walls around its perimeter. There are a powerful off-road vehicle that will take the triumphant thief down the mountain with the precious booty.

If you get it, you will have won and the first pages of the international press will open their editions with "Scandal! Theft of the Century".

Goals of the Game:

The players decide when starting the game which game mode they will play:


Win the first player to steal a jewel and escape.



All jewelry must be stolen, and that player who gets the most value by adding the points of the jewels obtained is the one that wins. In case of a tie, the thief who holds the Recesvinto's Crown will win.

217491.name: A Question of Religion II
217491.description:
From the introduction:

The baffling sequel to the adventure that was never made.

A Semberholme Elven patrol stumbles on the destroyed Wood Elven village of Yos which lies to the west of the large Elven settlement of Semberholme. The find was a scene of massive slaughter and bloodshed.

User summary:

The title indicates the adventure is a sequel - in some ways, the adventure reads as a sequel, but the preceding adventure was never published.

The scenario uses a house-rule variant for armor class and weapon damage (the variant rules are outlined in the document).

217492.name: A Question of Religion III
217492.description:
From the introduction:

The wacky conclusion to the trilogy that wasn’t.

The players are being sought out by a group of filthy fur clad
Eskimo type Barbarians, who hail from the glacier.

The Lead Barbarian tells the players: "Many bad snow orcs
are attacking our little village, they have it surrounded. We
hear you may help? We give lots of these..."

217493.name: The Bronze Flute
217493.description:
From the introduction:

Little did the hapless adventures know that the flute gave him
powers... strange powers... strange... spell like powers.

An Adventure for 3-6 characters level 6-9.

217494.name: The Lion and the Blades
217494.description:
From the introduction:

In front of the players spreads the dock area, where the docks and jetties of the harbor jut out into the Moonsea. Here, an interesting mixture of warehouses, businesses and homes creates an air of constant bustle and variety, a seeming haven to travelers and foreigners within this natural fort of a city.

The adventure is designed for a party of 2nd or 3rd level adventurers.

217495.name: Silver Scream
217495.description: Bring the iconic 80’s slasher movie to life in this intense, immersive board game. The innovative story-board mechanism puts you in front of the camera as the scenes unfold, leading you and your fellow cast members through a terrifying night in a variable wilderness setting. Use cunning to survive until dawn or stand and fight to stop the Killer once and for all. Gather Plot Points to maintain your Courage in the face of horror as your Supporting Cast is slaughtered around you. Will you be able to reveal the Killer’s vulnerabilities and face him (or her) down before the mayhem of Act 3 begins? Or will you simply run for your life, never knowing where terror will strike next? Either way, the Story Board will track the choices you’ve made and tell your tale of woe (or heroism) to all who dare to watch the Silver Scream...

217496.name: Gift Cube: Crazy Counting Party
217496.description: What did the tiger get as a great gift? And why did the penguin bring the same six gifts? Whoever can count the points correctly gets to unwrap the wacky gifts. Here we go! Throw the dice, count, receive gifts. A crazy game for 2-4 players ages 4-99 that helps develop counting and math skills!

217497.description:
These are faction dice for TANKS.

TANKS is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a tank platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory. TANKS is a flexible game with lots of ways to create a finely-tuned army that fits your play style.

The game is fast and furious, do-or-die. In half an hour, you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying), and be ready for the rematch!
boardgameaccessory: Tanks: British Sherman V and Firefly
217497.name: Tanks: Dice Set – British

217498.description:
These are faction dice for TANKS.

TANKS is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a tank platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory. TANKS is a flexible game with lots of ways to create a finely-tuned army that fits your play style.

The game is fast and furious, do-or-die. In half an hour, you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying), and be ready for the rematch!
boardgameaccessory: Tanks: German Panzer IV Tank Expansion
217498.name: Tanks: Dice Set – German

217499.description:
These are faction dice for TANKS.

TANKS is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a tank platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory. TANKS is a flexible game with lots of ways to create a finely-tuned army that fits your play style.

The game is fast and furious, do-or-die. In half an hour, you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying), and be ready for the rematch!
217499.name: Tanks: Dice Set – Soviet

217500.description:
These are faction dice for TANKS.

TANKS is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a tank platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory. TANKS is a flexible game with lots of ways to create a finely-tuned army that fits your play style.

The game is fast and furious, do-or-die. In half an hour, you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying), and be ready for the rematch!
217500.name: Tanks: Dice Set – US

217001.name: VR Snowballs
217001.description:
User Summary

VR Snowballs is a casual shooter game.

217002.name: Mega Math
videogamefranchise: Sierra Discovery Series (Sierra Entertainment Educational Games, US)
217002.description:
Description from back of game box

Move over, boring, computer-generated flash cards! Mega Math is here with the latest in multimedia technology, arcade-style action, proven teaching techniques, and good old-fashioned fun to create a uniquely effective way to memorize math facts.

217003.name: Inca II
217003.description:
Inca II: Wiracocha also released as Inca II: Nations of Immortality is a 1993 video game developed by Coktel Vision. It is the sequel of Inca, which places a war between the Incas and the Spaniards in space, 500 years into the future.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inca_II%3A_Wiracocha Inca II: Wiracocha]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217004.name: The Prophecy
217004.description:
The Prophecy (also known as Ween: The Prophecy) is a point and click adventure game developed by Coktel Vision and MDO, and published by Sierra On-Line in 1993 for DOS, Amiga, and Atari ST.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Prophecy_%28video_game%29 The Prophecy (video game)]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217005.name: Afterglow Miniatures Game
217005.description:
Afterglow Miniatures Game is a tabletop strategy miniature game set in a grim world ravaged by a tremendous cataclysm. Players use models in 32mm scale to represent their warbands fighting over resources, supplies, and territory.

Unlike other strategy miniature games, Afterglow is a game about survival where a player's tactics, decisions, clever use of units, and completion of scenario missions are more important than annihilating enemy units.

217006.description:
At long last, the circus is coming to Carcassonne. The ringmaster has organized a night full of stunning acrobatic routines that will leave you speechless, while the most talented artists show their latest tricks. Followers can now be trained to perform human pyramids, and a circus tent will attract the people of Carcassonne, while the ringmaster keeps things organized and visitors calm and quiet.

Carcassonne: Under the Big Top is the tenth large expansion for Carcassonne and the first large expansion released exclusively for the second edition of Carcassonne.
217006.name: Carcassonne: Under the Big Top

217007.name: La Criatura
217007.description:
Do you remember the movie of The Thing? That of the eighties, that of John Carpenter. You liked it, did not you? Well, look no further. If you want to relive the best moments of the film (if you suffer a horrible death you consider a good time), then The Creature is your game.

The Creature is a competitive card game in which you will all have to fight against all to escape with life from the scientific base in which you are locked together with an Being from Another World known as The Creature.

In this hidden role-playing game you will not have friends, because anyone can be infected. The only thing that matters is to survive and to escape in the only available place of the rescue helicopter ... although that supposes to finish with your companions.

The Creature is a card game for 3 to 10 players in which no one is who they seem to be and where paranoia reigns throughout the game. Use your event cards to beat your teammates, vote against them to sedate them, collect weapons for the final showdown and try to prevent The Creature from taking over your body. Does it feel like little stress? Then wait for the helicopter to land and you have to fight everyone to occupy the only seat.

A game of The Creature lasts from 30 minutes to an hour, depending on the number of players.

The game is not recommended for children under 13, we do not want children to become accustomed to crushing their friends.

The objective of the game is to escape from the research base on the helicopter. The bad thing is that there is only one place for a scientist, so only one of the players can escape the horror. Will it be a human who gets on the helicopter, one of the infected scientists or the creature itself?

The helicopter will arrive when all the turns of game are finished. There are as many turns in a game as participating players minus one, which are controlled in the time marker with the clock tab. The minimum number of turns to play is 2, and the maximum 10. This represents the difficulty or ease of the creature to infect scientists when the group is more or less numerous.

It can neutralize the Creature so that it does not continue to infect the scientists, sedating it twice (the first time the silk manages to escape).

The scientist who escapes in the helicopter wins the game, even if it is the creature or one of the infected will mean the end of humanity ...

Overview.

The game is divided into turns, and there are as many turns as players are present in the game minus one (maximum 10 turns), plus the final turn of the game, the helicopter phase where everyone fights against everyone to sit in the available seat and Escape from base. Each turn is divided into three phases:


Event Phase
Voting phase
Movement phase


During the events phase players put their event cards into action to produce effects during the game.

In the voting phase players use their voting to decide which scientist they will sedate.

The movement phase is played after the voting, and in it all players deliver their character cards (including that of The Creature) to the boss, who shuffles them and re-allocates them among the players, in such a way that the Creature moves from one scientist to another, infecting them.

The objective of the game is to escape in the helicopter. Players who have had the creature's card at some point become infected, and therefore will try to help the creature carry out its plans, complicating the existence of other players who are still human. The bad thing is that there will be moments during the game in which no one will know who is who, further sowing chaos in the game.

217008.name: Linnumäng
217008.description:
Educational game about Estonian birds.
Cards have photos, names, nests, eggs etc.
There are several game variants in this game.
You can play memory variant trying to guess what nests belongs to what birds. Player who finds correct pair gets it as a point.
If there is no cards left on the table player with the most cards is the winner

217011.name: Hecate's Mirror
217011.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every Lots of Horror offering provides an item lot presented as though part of an auction. This is an easy way to introduce the item into your game: someone bought the item and now all hell is breaking loose!

This release includes the Hecate's Mirror. Discovered during the mid-1700s in Athens during a construction project, this mirror is said to grant bad dreams (and worse) that sleep to close to it. Just what is this object's connection to the land of dreams and what could happen if its power is abused?

217012.description:
Description from the publisher:

In the second edition, Alchemical Crystal Quest has been changed completely in art illustrations and miniatures. New rules, story chapters and new mechanics are included.

Oh no! The evil sorcerer Darkthony has kidnapped our teacher Blue Hat, and he's looking for mega-crystals of power to dominate the Bat Islands. Our friend is retained in his Castle, and Darkthony has sent a lot of minions to get the 7 Crystals. We must stop him!

Fantasy cooperative board game. Take the role of an alchemist wizard and create the spells using crystal color gems combinations for fight with enemies, along 10 missions in a modular board campaign to know the complete history and save your alchemy teacher form the hands of the evil sorcerer Darkthony. Players win the game if they complete each story chapter. We can reduce our size, ride a pet or fight with a lot of different weapons cards and spell cards in a roll dice battle system. In some chapters, our wizards will fly with the pets to the sky in special aerial tiles for a flight fight missions. For 1-4 players. Search the keys, take magical artifacts, and commerce with your crystals to upgrade your weapons for complete the quest.

Create your own spells using a crystal combination in your character sheets to provide your wizard with special abilities and magic attacks. 40 to 120 minutes depending the mission. Miniatures for wizards, enemies and pets, all with cartoon look style. Can you save Blue Hat from the hands of Darkthony?
217012.name: Alchemical Crystal Quest (second edition)

217013.name: Bard Spells V (PRD)
217013.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level bard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

217014.name: Bard Spells V (3PP)
217014.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Bard Spells is a simple document that collects the bard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 5th-level bard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

217015.name: Level 8 Master
217015.description:
German Master Edition of Level Up

Even more Fun for Level 8-Fans!

Again it's about to collect cards, lay out cards, and get closer to the victore level by level. Now with new, challenging tasks and various interesting action cards! Who lays out the required combination first? Who finishes all 8 level first and wins?

Each player starts with a hand of 10 cards and has the task of Level 1 to lay out. Each turn the player has 3 actions in the following order:
1. He must draw a new card from the draw pile or other players discard pile.
2. He can lay out all needed cards to fullfill his task. After he fullfilled his task, he can lay out additional cards to each players display each round.
3. He must discard one card from his hand or play an action card.

The player discarding his last card in step 3 wins the round and goes up 2 Levels, each other player who fullfilled his task goes up one level. The new round beginns.

The player finishing Level 8 first wins the game.

217016.name: Body Count
217016.description: From the rules: "The object of the game is to predict the final BODY COUNT in an action video. Teams or individual Players advance from their predictions to the final BODY COUNT by answering question cards. The first player to advance from the final BODY COUNT to the center of the game board is the winner"

217018.name: Frankie's Food Truck Fiasco Game
217018.description:
Description from the publisher:

Order up! Foodies unite! Get a taste of these shape-tastic recipes for fun! Business at Frankie’s famous food truck is brisk! Kids take turns using the Frankie Squeezer to fill scrumptious orders. The first to deliver a 5-course meal is the winner!

Psst…They’re Learning!
Practices identifying geometric shapes
Develops fine motor skills
Improves strategic thinking skills
Encourages social skills and turn-taking

Board game designed to teach young children about shapes. Players spin to determine what shape of piece they can collect and then use the squeezer to add them to their player board. Once a player fills their board with the required shapes they win.

217020.name: Truck Off: The Food Truck Frenzy
217020.description:
Truck off is a lightweight food truck card game that packs some serious bite! In Truck Off, you send your food truck team hoping to score a sweet parking spot at a lucrative venue. Your timing and game plan will be critical to your success while your opponents will look for the perfect opportunity to get you to Truck Off!

Truck Off is played over 5 rounds where the winner is the player with the most money earned. Each round, players simultaneously select and then reveal which venue they will park at placing their food trucks next to that venue. Each player then simultaneously selects which special action(s) they choose to execute this round. Starting with the first player token, players play and execute one action in a clockwise manor until all actions have been played and executed. A die is then rolled at each venue to determine how many people actually showed up, and profits are split between each truck at the venue.

Truck Off game-play mechanically captures the ups and downs of food truck owner by rewarding both long-term planning and short-term tactics as well as throwing many curve-balls such as low venue attendance, competition, and crazy weather.

217021.name: Spillet om Klatremus og de andre dyrene i Hakkebakkeskogen
217021.description: The players are in a race through the woods to get to Papa Bears birthday party. On their way, all the players gather gingerbread and have to stay clear of the Fox. If the Fox catches you, you have to give him the gingerbreads you´ve collected, unless you amongst the ordinary gingerbreads have gingerbread with extra pepper, then the Fox don´t want them and you get to keep them. The player with the most gingerbread wins.

217022.name: Traponium
217022.description:
Using tiles showing the powers of two (or three in more complex levels), players move orthogonally across a randomly constructed board of numbers from one corner to the other. This is done by constructing equations producing the number to which they wish to move before drawing replacement tiles from the bag to replenish their stock.

A modular board, an optional dice determining the number of spaces a player may move, and the choice of exponent, allow for a variety of levels of difficulty. All levels will develop mathematical ability and forward planning.

217023.name: Naval Engagement
217023.description:
This 1870 title is a simple but very early game from McLoughlin Brothers, printed on a single sheet of paper. It shows an image of a coastal battery of 10 guns in the foreground exchanging fire with a fleet of 10 ships.

Each of the ships and guns is numbered from 3 to 12. Players take turns rolling 2D6, with snake-eyes a miss and any other number eliminating the ship or gun of that number. The first player to succeed in eliminating all of the opposing guns or ships wins.

While most of the ships are still three-masted sailing vessels, the fleet includes one Monitor-style ironclad and what looks like a two-masted steamship.

217024.name: Hulburg Burning
217024.description:
From the introduction:

Violence is on the on the rise, even more than expected. The heat is rising. People run amok. But greed does not appear to be the flame behind it.

Something much colder appears to drive the chaos. Can you track it downand remove it?

A D&D Adventurers League adventure set in Hulburg.

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

217025.name: Hulburg Rising
217025.description:
From the introduction:

Since the rebirth of Hulburg, the strong have preyed upon the weak, with only limited protection offered by the law. Recently, any resemblance of law and order has been threatened, and even the town’s greedy callous ruler cannot ignore the threat anymore.

A war is brewing. Can you stop it before it is too late?

A D&D Adventurers League adventure set in Hulburg.

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

217026.name: Hulburg Rebuilding
217026.description:
From the introduction:

Since the rebirth of Hulburg, the strong have preyed upon the weak, with only limited protection offered by the law. Recently, any resemblance of law and order has been threatened, and even the town’s greedy callous ruler cannot ignore the threat anymore.

A war is brewing.

Can you stop it before it is too late?

A D&D Adventurers League adventure set in Hulburg.

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

217027.name: Operation Barbarossa
217027.description:
User Summary

Conflicts: Operation Barbarossa is a turn based strategy game set on the Eastern Front during the Second World War. Created by Joni Nuutinen as part of the Conflict-Series.

The player commands the Axis forces in their invasion of the Soviet Union. The AI commands the Soviet forces. The Each unit can move between 0 and 3 spaces per turn. Moving into an enemy space causes combat. Supply is critical as being cut off can lead to a slow death as Soviet forces pour through the seams in your line.

A thoroughly engrossing tablet game sure to please any wargamer.

217028.name: A Green and Unpleasant Land
217028.description:
From the introduction:

As if the life-taking floods, earthquakes, famine, plague, pestilence, war and ever present threat of old age wasn’t enough, in the early 21st Century God gave another devastating twist of the knife in humanity’s guts; a ten-year barrage of unusually high and deadly solar radiation.

217029.name: Det Sidste Eventyr
217029.description:
Author's blurb:

When their violent, alcoholic parents have gone into their cups, escaping kids go to their invisible world Drømmeøen. Together, they go on adventures and prevail over their enemies. Life on Drømmeøen is carefree and full of pranks.

But it is impossible to escape from everyday life and soon enough fantasy and reality flow together. It becomes clear to the children that they have to choose.

217030.name: The Last Adventure: Characters
217030.description:
User summary:

Det Sidste Eventyr ("The Last Adventure") is published in Danish but was hosted for "international" play at Fastaval 2013. To facilitate non-Danish-speaking players, the characters from the game document were provided in English translation.

This separate document does not include the full rules, only the characters.

217031.name: Tilbagefald
217031.description:
Author's blurb:

Everything in our family was about father - if he was healthy or sick, sour or happy. Everything could go in five minutes. And I never knew when. And then it does not matter how nice we had it together the day before. Dinner was always the worst time of day. There we could not hide or avoid him.

I named one of my teddy bears "little father." I stroked him, put him to bed, and read aloud to him. I comforted him and hugged him tightly to me when he was upset. I gave him a nice meal and told him how much I liked him. And after a while the "little father" was completely healthy again.

At a young age I assumed the role of the "little adult". Half past four I went up to the bus to pick up mother from work and give her a "forecast", as we called it. Whether he slept, was acting crazy, or just drunk.

217032.name: The Laffer Utilities
videogameversion: North American DOS dual disk edition
217032.description:
User Summary

The Laffer Utilities is a comedic parody of the Norton Utilities software package, starring Sierra's Leisure Suit Larry. It includes several joke and trivia mini-programs designed to poke fun at the everyday office life of the era.

217033.name: Relapse: Characters
217033.description:
User summary:

Tilbagefald ("Relapse") is published in Danish but was hosted for "international" play at Fastaval 2012. To facilitate non-Danish-speaking players, the characters from the game document are provided in English translation.

This separate document does not include the full rules, only the characters.

217034.name: Zombie Action Wrestling: Return of the Wrestling Dead
rpg: Zombie Action Wrestling: Return of the Wrestling Dead
217034.description:
From the introduction:

It has been seven years since the end of the zombie apocalypse. Mankind is low in numbers but high in spirits, as governments and corporations labour to build a new world. And the zombies? They have been put to good use in the entertainment industry.
...
Your character is an “awakened” zombie, so he is in control of his body. That doesn’t mean, that you won´t get the odd craving for human brain - you are after all still a zombie. Occasionally, you even get the odd feeling that saying incoherent gurgling sounds is just the right thing for the moment.

User summary:

The game document includes numerous print-and-play components.

217035.name: Geek Out!: TableTop Limited Edition
217035.description:
Geek Out! is the outrageous game that finds out once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite pop culture subjects!

In the game, you will draw cards asking you to list things which fall under a certain category. Before you begin, however, the other players may try to steal your points (and bragging rights!), by bidding to list even more than the card requires. The bidding continues until one player is ready to “out-geek” their friends. Will you Geek Out!™ over comic books, fantasy, games, science fiction and more?

You don’t have to be a geek (but it helps!) to win this amazing social interaction and bluffing party game of geek lists!

The Geek Out! TableTop edition takes the game to the next level and finds out once and for all which player is the most knowledgeable about your favorite geeky pop culture subjects!

This Limited Edition includes a bonus deck with additional lists.

217036.name: Hoyle Classic Card Games
217036.description:
Hoyle Classic Card Games (Hoyle 4) was a remake of Volume I, released with VGA support, speech and original soundtrack. There was a set with 'Classic Characters' to play with and one with an increased number of Sierra characters as well. Load screens involve a silly comments made by the Classic characters, in relationship to whatever game was loading. The number of games was increased to eight, with the inclusion of Contract Bridge and Euchre.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hoyle%27s_Official_Book_of_Games Hoyle's Official Book of Games]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217037.name: Slater & Charlie Go Camping
217037.description:
Slater & Charlie Go Camping is a video game developed and published by Sierra On-Line. It was released on DOS and Macintosh on May 19, 1993. It is a 3rd-person perspective educational game.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slater_%26_Charlie_Go_Camping Slater & Charlie Go Camping]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217038.name: The Time Warp of Dr. Brain
217038.description:
The Time Warp of Dr. Brain is the fourth installment of the educational game series Dr. Brain by Sierra Entertainment. The game's structure is similar to its predecessor, The Lost Mind of Dr. Brain: the player must complete several puzzles which appeal to a specific part of the brain; however, this game also adds a time-period based theme to each puzzle and the game's theme overall is time travel.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Time Warp of Dr. Brain", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217041.name: Thexder 95
217041.description:
Thexder 95 (also called Thexder for Windows 95) is a Windows 95 remake of the original Thexder game, which was built with Microsoft's Game SDK (precursor of DirectX). In this game, Thexder can become a tank and jet, and has a large number of new weapons, from grenades to thermal bombs. The game runs in multiple windows: the main view, and several smaller windows each having a different function, e.g., ammo count, map, and actual game, that the gamer could open and close at will during play.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thexder Thexder]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217042.name: Metaltech: EarthSiege Expansion Pack
217042.description:
In 1995, an expansion pack for Earthsiege was released featuring a full-motion video introduction. The expansion pits humanity against a second wave of Cybrid attackers 3 months after the end of the original game. The expansion pack featured new content such as new vehicles and weapons.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metaltech%3A_Earthsiege Metaltech: Earthsiege]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217043.name: Metaltech: EarthSiege Speech Pack
217043.description:
Game description from back of box

The Speech Pack plunges you deeper into the world of EarthSiege robotic combat. Now, alongside the digitized explosions and rumbling bass of HERC robotic combat, the voices of your commander, fellow pilots, and mechanics accompany game play, heightening drama and intensifying the action -- a must for those who desire the maximum game experience.

217044.name: The View from Sprogø
rpg: Wrong and Dangerous: The View from Sprogø
217044.description:
From the introduction:

On a small ferry four women in rough clothes sit quivering in the cold wind. They are being taken away from their families and everything they know, and on their way to a life at an isolated asylum for morally deficient women located on the tiny Danish island of Sprogø.

Ahead of them awaits a life secluded from society. A life of discipline and regularity under careful observation by the watchful eyes of the institution’s Headmistress and Psychiatrists.

Perhaps in time, if the treatment proves to be successful, they will be allowed back out into society again, however, it is far from certain that persons so deranged can improve their condition.

217045.name: Yuashodo Oshebu Emeshi
217045.description:
Author's blurb:

You can only create energy and matter with desire, alter the world with your will, your own body is superior to that of others.

What will you do with this power? What will stop you? Maybe even death will not.

217046.name: Time~Spiral
217046.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Time~Spiral is designed to enable a fast-pulsed gaming experience incorporating tense high adventure in any type of suitable setting and genre. It takes its inspiration from many sources of fantasy, science fiction, and horror fiction.

This game system suits absolutely any timeline whatsoever, from Fantasy through Earth Historical, to Sci-Fi. The Player Characters are the Heroes of their age, striving to defeat the ubiquitous forces of evil.

217047.name: Crazy Nick's Software Picks: Leisure Suit Larry's Casino
videogamefranchise: Crazy Nick's Software Picks (Sierra Entertainment Budget Games, US)
217047.description:
User Summary

Part of Sierra's "Crazy Nick's Software Picks" casual budget line, this game stars Leisure Suit Larry protagonist Larry Laffer. It features DOS versions of slots, blackjack, and poker.

217048.name: Crazy Nick's Software Picks: Parlor Games with Laura Bow
videogamefranchise: Crazy Nick's Software Picks (Sierra Entertainment Budget Games, US)
217048.description:
User Summary

Part of Sierra's "Crazy Nick's Software Picks" casual budget line, this game stars Colonel's Bequest protagonist Laura Bow. It features DOS versions of yacht and dominoes.

217049.name: Crazy Nick's Software Picks: Robin Hood's Games of Skill and Chance
videogamefranchise: Crazy Nick's Software Picks (Sierra Entertainment Budget Games, US)
217049.description:
User Summary

Part of Sierra's "Crazy Nick's Software Picks" casual budget line, this game stars Conquests of the Longbow protagonist Robin Hood. It features standalone DOS versions of several minigames from Conquests of the Longbow: archery, Nine Men's Morris, and sticks.

217050.name: Crazy Nick's Software Picks: Roger Wilco's Spaced Out Game Pack
videogamefranchise: Crazy Nick's Software Picks (Sierra Entertainment Budget Games, US)
217050.description:
User Summary

Part of Sierra's "Crazy Nick's Software Picks" casual budget line, this game stars Space Quest protagonist Roger Wilco. It features standalone DOS versions of several minigames from the Space Quest series: Ms. Astro Chicken, Monolith Burger, and Sand Skimmer.

217051.name: Crazy Nick's Software Picks: King Graham's Board Game Challenge
videogamefranchise: Crazy Nick's Software Picks (Sierra Entertainment Budget Games, US)
217051.description:
User Summary

Part of Sierra's "Crazy Nick's Software Picks" casual budget line, this game stars King's Quest protagonist King Graham. It features DOS versions of backgammon and checkers.

217052.name: Oil's Well (1990)
217052.description:
Oil's Well is a computer game distributed by Sierra On-Line in 1983, and again in 1990. The game was programmed by Thomas J. Mitchell and Bill Sargent. Bill Sargent went on to work on The Sims and SimCity 2000. Oil's Well is similar to the 1982 arcade game Anteater.

The player attempts to manage an oil drilling operation and collect oil. This is done by moving the drill head through a maze using four directional control buttons; the head is trailed by a pipeline connecting it to the base. Subterranean creatures populate the maze; the head can destroy the creatures, but the pipeline is vulnerable. As the player traverses the maze, the pipe grows longer, but pressing a button quickly retracts the head. The player can advance through eight different levels.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oil%27s_Well Oil's Well]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217053.name: Evolvation
217053.description:
A new multiplayer space shooter!

Evolvation is a multiplayer arena space flying shooter with multiple game modes which can be played solo as well as team-based gameplay.

An arena-like multiplayer space flying shooter which never stops to have action! It is a game which does not require extensive game hours in order to keep up with your friends. But still some amazing perks can be acquired by gaining experience points! Evolvation in an arena based multiplayer game like Unreal tournament, call of duty (multiplayer), Quake, etc.. This means that a continuous player to player interaction is inevitable. Other players are the central game elements.

Source: The Game Website.

217054.name: The Narrow Isle
217054.description:
From the introduction:

A group of travellers break their journey on an islet in the River Hest, and there they discover a small ancient structure. As the oncoming storm moves downriver, their serendipitous shelter proves to have a few surprises for them...

This adventure is for any mix of 3-5 Wide Land characters, who need not be acquainted, but the presence of a Priest or two might add further interest. It is intended to be played in a single session.

217055.name: Setting Construction Kit
217055.description:
From the introduction:

This booklet contains blank sheets to aid a GM in constructing a setting for the Pith role-playing system. The tables from the original rules are included for handy reference. This also allows the GM to simply photocopy the existing tables and cross out skills and equipment inappropriate to his environment.

217056.name: Twilight's Dawn (Issue 1 - Apr 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Building your Background: How do you know Ari Naraheim?

217057.name: Ulysses and the Golden Fleece
217057.description:
Ulysses and the Golden Fleece is a graphic adventure game released in 1981. It was created by Bob Davis and Ken Williams. With a graphic at the top of the game screen, the player navigates the game via a two-word command parser.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ulysses_and_the_Golden_Fleece Ulysses and the Golden Fleece]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

217058.name: Wrath of Denethenor
217058.description:
Description from back of game box

Welcome to Deledain, an imaginary world ravaged by the torrents of war. The four lords of Deledain once ruled their kingdoms independently and peacefully, but a small border skirmish mushroomed into the destruction of their four lands. Like a phoenix from the ashes, the evil Denethenor rose to dominate the weakened world.

You begin the game by taking on the role of the most unlikely of heroes, a scoundrel explorer out to pillage the war-torn countryside. However, with every successful raid on castle, town and village, you take another step closer to the ultimate battle with Denethenor, the prince of evil.

Wrath of Denethenor is a fantasy role-playing adventure game featuring superior graphics and programming plus a plot elaborate enough to hold the interest of even the most sophisticated adventurer. Animated magic spells and traps provide a visual spectacle, while elaborate sound effects complete the scene.

217059.name: White Box: Expanded Lore
217059.description:
Publisher's blurb:

White Box: Expanded Lore is a supplement for White Box and is compatible with any other Swords & Wizardry game. It adds four new character classes: the Bard, the Paladin, the Monk and the Druid.

Furthermore, this book presents optional, expanded rules designed for long White Box campaigns.

rpgseries: PER - Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventures
217060.name: Crazy Gnome
217060.description:
A One-Round Living Greyhawk Perrenland Regional Adventure

User summary:

This scenario was developed and circulated but never received final formatting for widespread play. The body of the document is complete but the front-matter primarily is unedited boilerplate text. The title given here is commonly used but unofficial.

For characters level 2 - 10.

From the introduction:
